story:
From Sweden to Mongolia, the tale of 6 men, growing up.

July 14th 2013, we set out on a journey of a life time, driving two piece of shit cars (engine capacity of max 1.2) from Sweden via Czech Rep. to Mongolia. We're doing this for charity, and with the hopes that it will give us some hair on our chests ... at last.

We're 6 friends who are standing with one leg in the I-still-think-I'm-a-teenager world, and the other in the adult world. We've all realised that it's time to take that big step into adulthood, but before we do, we want to go out with a bang. A huge fscking bang (Yes, File System Check Bang, what did you think we meant?), and document all the crazy insane shit we will do since this is indeed, our last journey as non adults.

During the trip, we will document everything, in pictures, videos, comic drawings and texts, which will all be shared with the world in order to help make it a little less big, a little less scary and a whole lot more fun.

We're cartoonists, writers, photographers and coders, so the things we'll make for the audience to enjoy during the trip will be endless, priceless and most probably funny as hell :)

 

The Un-Route

Sweden > Denmark > Germany > Czech Rep > Germany > Austria > Slovenia > Croatia > Serbia > Bulgaria > Turkey > Georgia > Azerbaijan > Turkmenistan > Uzbekistan > Kazakhstan > Russia > Mongolia.

Pretty amazing trip, don't you agree?

 

Lets help each other, shall we?

In order to do this, we need help, yes. That's why you are reading this right now.

The break down of costs? I'm glad you asked, here's the list of the things we need help with, it's somewhere around the amazingly high number of $18,500.

  • Visas for the 6 members: $2,000
  • Gas allowance: $2,000
  • Equipment for survival on the road for 40 days: $1,500
  • Food allowance 6 people: $1,000
  • 2 piece of shit cars, fully equiped: ~$12,000

Everything left over from this indiegogo-fund-raising (if we can get cheaper cars and stuff like that), will be donated to our charity of choice, SOS Children’s Villages, and we'll do our best to keep the cost down so that as much money as possible will end up helping the children.

For helping us, you can get pretty sweet deals if you ask me (you asked me, right?). Take a peek to the right, and choose the funding option that suits you, and most importantly, your wallet. Don't over-do it, we still have love for you even if you don't feel like giving us a bone, at least you will help spread the word about what we're doing to all your friends instead.

 

More info about the rally?

The breakdown:

  • Approx 12,000km depending on the route
  • From Sweden to Ulan Bator (Mongolia)
  • 300+ teams – no official price given to first comers to Ulan Bator
  • Partially challenging or even no roads
  • To make it even harder no fancy cars are allowed – max 1.2 litre engines. 4×4 are an absolute NO and other equipment such as an GPS’ shouldn’t be used – this means paper maps only or navigation by the stars
  • Teams enjoy complete freedom to pick their own route
  • It starts on Saturday the 13th July 2013 – we need to get the the finish within 3 1/2 weeks or we miss our flights back…

The Mongol Rally is 12,000 km of messy, euphoric, adrenaline-filled adventure. The goal is to get your car from Europe to Ulaanbaatar in a month, then auction your car off to charity.

Raising Money for Charity

Epic adventure is not the only draw with with Mongol Rally. Raising money for charity is a HUGE part of the rally. Each team is required to raise at least 1,000 GBP for charity before the rally. 500 GBP will go towards the rally’s charity, Cool Earth and the rest goes to a charity chosen by the team, in our case the SOS Children’s Villages.

What about the car?

Choosing a car for the rally is a challenge and hopefully a lot of fun as well. There are a couple of restrictions for the rally. The car has to have an engine size of 1.2 litres or less, the car must be registered after 2004, and taking a 4×4 or large vehicle is considered being a pansy.

“10,000 miles of adventuring bliss through deserts, mountains and steppe tackled in a car your Granny would use for shopping. The Mongol Rally is hurling yourself at one-third of the Earth’s surface in woefully unsuitable vehicles to see what happens…”

-Mongol Rally HQ

Things that mongol rally might give us:

  • The chance to get stuck, lost and full of tales of adventure
  • A few bucket loads of good karma
  • A cuddly toy (actually that’s a lie)

 

That's it people, I hope you can find it in your hearts to help us out making this happen.

And for the love of Cthulhu, share this page to everyone you know! Let's make history together!!
story_txt:
From Sweden to Mongolia, the tale of 6 men, growing up.
July 14th 2013, we set out on a journey of a life time, driving two piece of shit cars (engine capacity of max 1.2) from Sweden via Czech Rep. to Mongolia. We're doing this for charity, and with the hopes that it will give us some hair on our chests ... at last.
We're 6 friends who are standing with one leg in the I-still-think-I'm-a-teenager world, and the other in the adult world. We've all realised that it's time to take that big step into adulthood, but before we do, we want to go out with a bang. A huge fscking bang (Yes, File System Check Bang, what did you think we meant?), and document all the crazy insane shit we will do since this is indeed, our last journey as non adults.
During the trip, we will document everything, in pictures, videos, comic drawings and texts, which will all be shared with the world in order to help make it a little less big, a little less scary and a whole lot more fun.
We're cartoonists, writers, photographers and coders, so the things we'll make for the audience to enjoy during the trip will be endless, priceless and most probably funny as hell :)
 
The Un-Route

Sweden > Denmark > Germany > Czech Rep > Germany > Austria > Slovenia > Croatia > Serbia > Bulgaria > Turkey > Georgia > Azerbaijan > Turkmenistan > Uzbekistan > Kazakhstan > Russia > Mongolia.
Pretty amazing trip, don't you agree?
 


Lets help each other, shall we?

In order to do this, we need help, yes. That's why you are reading this right now.
The break down of costs? I'm glad you asked, here's the list of the things we need help with, it's somewhere around the amazingly high number of $18,500.

Visas for the 6 members: $2,000
Gas allowance: $2,000
Equipment for survival on the road for 40 days: $1,500
Food allowance 6 people: $1,000
2 piece of shit cars, fully equiped: ~$12,000

Everything left over from this indiegogo-fund-raising (if we can get cheaper cars and stuff like that), will be donated to our charity of choice, SOS Children’s Villages, and we'll do our best to keep the cost down so that as much money as possible will end up helping the children.
For helping us, you can get pretty sweet deals if you ask me (you asked me, right?). Take a peek to the right, and choose the funding option that suits you, and most importantly, your wallet. Don't over-do it, we still have love for you even if you don't feel like giving us a bone, at least you will help spread the word about what we're doing to all your friends instead.
 


More info about the rally?
The breakdown:

Approx 12,000km depending on the route
From Sweden to Ulan Bator (Mongolia)
300+ teams – no official price given to first comers to Ulan Bator
Partially challenging or even no roads
To make it even harder no fancy cars are allowed – max 1.2 litre engines. 4×4 are an absolute NO and other equipment such as an GPS’ shouldn’t be used – this means paper maps only or navigation by the stars
Teams enjoy complete freedom to pick their own route
It starts on Saturday the 13th July 2013 – we need to get the the finish within 3 1/2 weeks or we miss our flights back…



The Mongol Rally is 12,000 km of messy, euphoric, adrenaline-filled adventure. The goal is to get your car from Europe to Ulaanbaatar in a month, then auction your car off to charity.
Raising Money for Charity
Epic adventure is not the only draw with with Mongol Rally. Raising money for charity is a HUGE part of the rally. Each team is required to raise at least 1,000 GBP for charity before the rally. 500 GBP will go towards the rally’s charity, Cool Earth and the rest goes to a charity chosen by the team, in our case the SOS Children’s Villages.
What about the car?
Choosing a car for the rally is a challenge and hopefully a lot of fun as well. There are a couple of restrictions for the rally. The car has to have an engine size of 1.2 litres or less, the car must be registered after 2004, and taking a 4×4 or large vehicle is considered being a pansy.
“10,000 miles of adventuring bliss through deserts, mountains and steppe tackled in a car your Granny would use for shopping. The Mongol Rally is hurling yourself at one-third of the Earth’s surface in woefully unsuitable vehicles to see what happens…”
-Mongol Rally HQ
Things that mongol rally might give us:

The chance to get stuck, lost and full of tales of adventure
A few bucket loads of good karma
A cuddly toy (actually that’s a lie)

 
That's it people, I hope you can find it in your hearts to help us out making this happen.
And for the love of Cthulhu, share this page to everyone you know! Let's make history together!!

story:
HI, my name is Josh Malneritch!


I'm a Seattle based photographer with a passion for travel. I love meeting new faces and seeing new places. Music and a good latte really rule my world.

Recently finding myself struggling to find my "calling" in life led me to discover that my true desire is to travel the world and see places through the lens of my camera, nothing–in the whole world–could make my heart happier.

The other half of my heart is bent towards helping others in any way possible, recently I was informed of an individual making a difference across the world and wanted to help any way I could. Rebecca Kuntz, who is fighting for the health of many children of Ghana, Africa. She has provided many children with life saving surgery and making a difference in the community at large. Her heart is such a treasure and I am so excited to play a small part in such an amazing cause. I will be donating %100 percent of my proceeds directly to her. for more information of her cause please visit http://together-we-are.com 

Hopefully, I will be able to visit Ghana with my camera and share even more of her story!

This campaign is just a launching pad for my wanderlust. There are so many places in the United States that are just as extravagant as many of the World Wonders, and more specifically, the west coast. I want to travel some of the great landmarks that reside between the borders of Canada and Mexico, and document the whole trip from my camera. So why not explore the unknown right in your very own backyard? A question I asked myself, "Why not?" Quickly after some excitement of making my dreams unfold, I realized I need YOUR help. This entire campaign will NOT be possible with out you.

The Details

The Breakdown: 

Your contribution will be used for a vast range of things. I will be traveling roughly 3,500 miles in about 3 weeks. So you guessed it, I will be needing a lot of gasoline and food, the two most important things. Thats roughly $1,800 alone for gas, food, and camping.

One of the most important parts of the whole idea and heart behind this trip is to involve you and make you feel like you are traveling at my side (you never know how many selfies you'll find on the disposable cameras.) To make you as involved as possible the perks I have set up are all out of pocket costs. From photo prints and disposable cameras, to USB drives, shipping and delivering of all items will land somewhere around $600.

It roughly cost $2,000 dollars to provide a successful surgery for a single child. Let's partner together to save a child in need.

After all expenses are paid for %100 of the proceeds will be donated directly to Rebecca Kuntz, who is fighting for the health of many children of Ghana, Africa. She has provided many children with life saving surgery and making a difference in the community at large. Her heart is such a treasure and I am so excited to play a small part in such an amazing cause.


The Impact

This campaign will be providing as much medical attention to as many helpless children and families that your donations can reach. Making a difference in countless lives. I know that Rebecca will forever be changed by your generosity as well as myself. There is an amazing connection between passion and creativity and linking the two together you begin to find an unstoppable force.

There comes a point in everyone's life that reflecting on your past makes you wonder if you really lived, or just let time pass by. I've been struck with too many realities of life being too short, the closest of which being my father, who passed away at the age of 36, not a day goes by that I don't think about making him proud. The biggest reminder everyday of my life is to live life hard, you only get one shot. I'm ready to step out of comfort zone and face the road to extraordinary wonders, not only to share with you but to share with those i meet along the way. I hoping to be that whisper in someones ear that encourages them to fulfill their dreams, to take heart. I want to create a ripple effect of "YOLOing", or as some of my friends say, "riding the Yolo-coaster," as funny or cliche as it sounds, its true; "You Only Live Once." So for me this trip is a stepping stone to hopefully fulfilling some of my wildest dreams. Ultimately checking my pulse, and going for it!

TAKE HEART, EXPLORE.

#takeheartexplore


Other Ways You Can Help

Please, if you'd like to help in other ways besides financially please feel to use the Indiegogo share tools! The only way this will become a reality is with your help and drive to share with others.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Summary

Clever Caps are bottle caps which are ready to be upcycled as building blocks instead of going to the trash bin. They were designed to replace standard bottle caps in consumer products (e.g. bottled water, milk, juice, soda, etc.). They were also designed to work as Lego-compatible building blocks.


So, imagine next time you go shopping you can choose between a bottle of water closed either with a standard cap or with a Clever Cap. If you choose the bottle closed with a Clever Cap you will automatically get a building block. If you have a collection of Legos, MegaBlocks, Kreos or many of the most popular building block brands, you will probably be able to play with a single Clever Cap together with your other blocks. If you don't have or don't like building blocks you can give your  Clever Caps to those who would like to play or build objects with them.

To learn more about Clever Caps, you can visit our previous campaing page right here at Indiegogo: www.indiegogo.com/projects/bottle-caps-which-can-be-reused-as-building-blocks.  Unfortunately, although we have gotten contributions from 142 friends, we had only few contributions outside our closest network, and did not reach our financial goal there. But we also had good news. And that is why we decided to launch this new campaign: As a fruit of our previous campaing, we started donating Clever Caps to charity institutions: Each dollar we got under "donate Clever Caps" was converted into 10 Clever Caps for donation.

The picture below shows  the first 9 Clever Caps donations. 

The institutions included daycare and recreation centers, public schools, orphanages, and a shelter for children/adults with severe cerebral palsy. The complete list of institutions we have donated Clever Caps so far (many more are to come) is available at this link. 
The success was so big that we decided to launch this new campaign and keep it running under "InDemand" so that more people will be able to be part of the history for both Clever Caps and many charity institutions. We will be happy to learn about other institutions not only in Brazil but all over the world. So, if you have indications, please let us know.

Below we have additional information about Clever Caps and our crowdfunding campaign in form of the traditional questions: What, Who, Where, When, Why, How, How Much.


What?

What are Clever Caps? In addition to the summary above, information about Clever Caps is available at the video below and also at our previous campaign page at: www.indiegogo.com/projects/bottle-caps-which-can-be-reused-as-building-blocks.  


What our campaign contributors will get? In addition to know they are helping Clever Caps project, our contributors will have 2 options for perks: 
  1. Donate Clever Caps: each $ 1 will be converted into 10 Clever Caps to be donated to charity institutions.
  2. Get/Send Clever Caps (set of 1,000 caps): $ 100 for 1,000 Clever Caps (pick up to 4 colors at your choice, in sets of 250 multiples). Shipping costs included (worldwide).

Clever Caps 4 x 250 = 1,000 Kit



Note: We decided to set the size of the Get/Send to 1,000 caps due to the high shipping costs. If you want to suggest other perks (e.g. lower number of caps, prebuilt objects, etc.), please let us know. 


What can I build with Clever Caps? Like any building block, there are many things you can build with Clever Caps. Just for example, here are some things which can be built with as few as 10 Clever Caps:


Flower (10 Clever Caps)



Airplane (20 Clever Caps)



Pencil Cup (60 Clever Caps)



Desk Organizer (156 Clever Caps, for lateral wall)



Box (1240 Clever Caps, for lateral wall. Approximate size: 37 cm x 37 cm x 30 cm*)

* As reference: a 9,5 cm x 9,5cm "wall" takes 30 Clever Caps


Letter "B" (240 Clever Caps, Approximate size: 32 cm x 37 cm**)

** You can "draw" or "write" with Clever Caps as if they were 31.8 mm x 9.6 mm pixels.


Car Body (4 Clever Caps)



Bottle Opener (1 Clever Cap)

For those with difficulties to open bottles, a single Clever Cap can be connected to a bottle closed with a second Clever Cap, and work as a lever. Then, opening will be much easier.

Building Block (1 Clever Cap)

As simple as that: Each Clever Cap is a building block. Under Clever Caps concept, what used to be trash will now be ready to be upcycled.


Who?
Clever Caps project was born at the Brazilian company Clever Pack (www.cleverpack.com.br). This crowdfunding campaign was set by the inventors Henry Suzuki (innovation consultant) and Claudio Patrick Vollers (plastic specialist).

Where?
The first product closed with a Clever Cap to reach the shelves will be a local Brazilian mineral water brand. We hope the impact of the first launch will increase awareness and about Clever Caps platform, and companies all over the world will want to addopt them in replacement of standard caps. Regarding to Clever Caps donations, we started by institutions nearby Sao Paulo city (Brazil) for we were able to deliver the caps without incurring in additional expenses for shipping. Contributors in other cities/countries can indicate institutions they want to donate Clever Caps. In that case, please use "get Clever Caps" perk option,

When?

We were to make the first launch in April 2015, but we had problems with our low capacity molds. So launch was postponed. Expected launch date is now July 2015. For donations, we are still delivering remaining caps we had alread produced. Full delivery of all donations will be performed by october 2015 when we expect to have started production with bigger molds.

How?

There are many ways you can contribute with this campaign. For example:
  • Making a financial contribution (each dollar counts).
  • Sharing this campaing with your friends.
  • Indicating to us charity institutions you would like to donate Clever Caps

How Much?

The financial goal for our previous campaign was set as $ 100,000. That was the ammount we predicted for investment in higher production capacity molds for 3 Clever Caps models (round, square and rectangular), plus one additional round with incorporated safety seal. We did not reach our goal, and noticed we should start smaller, and then increase production on an organic rate (more sales, more demand, bigger molds). 
Now we set this campaign to $ 500 dollars, which is the minimum value allowed by Indiegogo. The idea is to make it very clear thar each dollar will make a difference for us and for the ones who will get Clever Caps donations. Each dollar will be converted into 10 caps for charity institutions. 10 caps are enough to build a flower. 20 caps are enough to build a small airplane. 1 cap will make most building block brands collections grow.

Why?

By contributing with this campaign you will help not only Clever Caps project, but many charity institutions which will receive caps now as donations. In the longer term, we expect many more Clever Caps will reach people who most need them, but then for free, for the caps will be in the broad market replacing standar caps which now are thrown in the trash bin. Contributing with our campaign is a way to tell consumer products companies that you support ideas like the Clever Caps.

story:
RATIONALE: The reason it's hard to rest or sleep while traveling is because you can't keep your head, neck and back perpendicular and at a 90-degree angle similar to how you sleep in bed at night. This results in...

  • Jet Lag
  • Neck and Body Pain
  • Awkwardly Waking Up On Your Fellow Passengers

Throw away all those useless travel pillows

 

Enjoy truly great sleep while traveling with the Nod Travel Pillow!

The ULTIMATE Travel Sleep Solution! 

 

Here is what makes the Nod Travel Pillow "The Ultimate Sleep Travel Solution"...

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Travel Blanket is a wind and water proof, compact travel blanket that is the perfect solution for staying warm and cozy on drafty planes, trains and cars. Easily stowed in a carry on, backpack, briefcase or purse. Never use an airplane blanket again!

 Features Include...

  • "Open Back Design" in-order to step into the blanket all at once, which also means the blanket cannot fall off when asleep and covers you from head to toe
  • Easy to slip on and off while fully seated in cramped quarters
  • Optional Hood for keeping your head warm and privacy
  • Front Storage Pocket perfect for keeping your smart phone or tablet while listening to music or while you sleep; theft prevention
  • Ultra thin PU fabric is draft proof and moisture resistant 
  • Folds up into itself as a small bag for easy storage, making it easy and minimal for long journeys (both pieces designed to fit into pocket for storage - 5"x7"); see below 

Nod Travel Pillow + Travel Blanket

 

 

 

Act Quickly! These deals won't last long!

Hello everyone and welcome to ourNod Travel Pillow and Pod Travel Blanket by Zdoze Indiegogo InDemand page.  

Through extensive travels over the years as a professional commercial interior designer, I was always searching for a better way to rest on a plane, car or any form of transportation. I found traveling to be a tiring task and never quite found the perfect solution for really being able to rest on a plane or in a car.     

For years I searched to find a solution for forward head motion but nothing on the market seemed to work. I also designed many prototypes for travel pillows and blankets but nothing worked as it should.  All were too bulky and none solved the forward head motion issue. 

The simple solution came to me while traveling on a plane to visit a friend.  When I arrived back home, I sat out to create my simple and effective design and wallah... the Nod Travel Pillow was born !

I am very excited to bring this product to Kickstarter and see people everywhere enjoying real rest and comfort as they travel to their destinations all over the globe. This simple yet revolutionary designed product will soon change the way the whole world travels.

Thank you for your support of the Nod Travel Pillow and I hope you find yourself more comfortable,rested and refreshed on your next adventure.

Wishing you safe and restful travels,

Paula Blankenship

Neck and Body Pain
Awkwardly Waking Up On Your Fellow Passengers
Throw away all those useless travel pillows Enjoy truly great sleep while traveling with the Nod Travel Pillow!The ULTIMATE Travel Sleep Solution!  Here is what makes the Nod Travel Pillow "The Ultimate Sleep Travel Solution"...      The Travel Blanket is a wind and water proof, compact travel blanket that is the perfect solution for staying warm and cozy on drafty planes, trains and cars. Easily stowed in a carry on, backpack, briefcase or purse. Never use an airplane blanket again! Features Include...
"Open Back Design" in-order to step into the blanket all at once, which also means the blanket cannot fall off when asleep and covers you from head to toe
Easy to slip on and off while fully seated in cramped quarters
Optional Hood for keeping your head warm and privacy
Front Storage Pocket perfect for keeping your smart phone or tablet while listening to music or while you sleep; theft prevention
Ultra thin PU fabric is draft proof and moisture resistant 
Folds up into itself as a small bag for easy storage, making it easy and minimal for long journeys (both pieces designed to fit into pocket for storage - 5"x7"); see below 
Nod Travel Pillow + Travel Blanket      Act Quickly! These deals won't last long! Hello everyone and welcome to ourNod Travel Pillow and Pod Travel Blanket by Zdoze Indiegogo InDemand page.  Through extensive travels over the years as a professional commercial interior designer, I was always searching for a better way to rest on a plane, car or any form of transportation. I found traveling to be a tiring task and never quite found the perfect solution for really being able to rest on a plane or in a car.     For years I searched to find a solution for forward head motion but nothing on the market seemed to work. I also designed many prototypes for travel pillows and blankets but nothing worked as it should.  All were too bulky and none solved the forward head motion issue. The simple solution came to me while traveling on a plane to visit a friend.  When I arrived back home, I sat out to create my simple and effective design and wallah... the Nod Travel Pillow was born !I am very excited to bring this product to Kickstarter and see people everywhere enjoying real rest and comfort as they travel to their destinations all over the globe. This simple yet revolutionary designed product will soon change the way the whole world travels.Thank you for your support of the Nod Travel Pillow and I hope you find yourself more comfortable,rested and refreshed on your next adventure.Wishing you safe and restful travels,Paula Blankenship

story:
THE QUESTION

A backpackable bow? Aren't there plenty of takedown bows that fit into a backpack?

Well, not quite. In fact when you start looking at which backpacks most people use and how long takedown bows actually are, you realize that the Ranger is a truly unique bow specifically designed to fit INSIDE a backpack, requires no tools to setup or maintain, accepts sights and quivers and stores takedown arrows inside the riser. Now that's quite something in the bow world.

 

THE CHALLENGE

With the huge popularity of our current folding bows and numerous requests to design another bow that can accept sites and other accessories, we decided to design a new backpackable takedown bow that not only fulfilled this need, but came in at a more affordable price point to make a compact takedown backpackable bow accessible to the majority of people.

Survival Archery Systems was established in 2014 and currently manufacturers all its bows in Lexington, Kentucky, USA

 

The challenge was to develop a bow that could pack down into a small 22" backpack, yet was long enough that it did not stack. Stacking is a phenomenon whereby a bow's draw force curve is smooth in the beginning of the draw and then suddenly shoots up at the end, making it almost impossible to draw it back further. This typically happens when a bow is too short for the archer or when the limb to riser ratio is incorrect.

For a bow to not stack for taller archers, it needs to be about 60" in length or longer. And to get a 60" takedown bow into a 22" backpack is where the big design challenge comes in. That was a job for our lead engineer. 

Why is 22" such an important dimension for "backpack-ability"? 

Well, most outdoorsmen prefer to carry 1-day or 3-day packs into the field. These packs are about 22-23" in length and are easier to move around with especially when on the hunt.

A standard sized one-day backpack used by many hunters.

 

Our research showed that there are currently no 60"+ bows on the market that can fit into this length of backpack other than those already offered by our company, Survival Archery Systems, which was founded back in 2014 and continues to produce bows in Kentucky, USA even during the COVID-19 pandemic. Some other bows come close, but the limbs are around 24-26" in length when taken down and just don't fit. Bows with 22" limbs are typically shorter than 56" total bow length and therefore stack fairly quickly when used by taller archers.

Another important thing to consider is that most recurve limbs are not very compact nor robust when thrown around in a pack. As you will see later, we overcame the need for using a recurve style limb to reduce stacking by using a straight deep flex composite fiber limb that allows for a smooth draw and an efficient stroke and is super strong to boot. Deep flex is something traditional materials are just not as good at.

And don't worry about arrows being too long to pack either, as we have a solution for that too with our awesome takedown arrows we have been selling since 2014. These actually fit inside the riser of the Ranger Takedown Survival Bow and can be purchased separately.

 
 

THE DESIGN CRITERIA AND RANGER TAKEDOWN SURVIVAL BOW DEVELOPMENT

So our lead engineer got to work designing a new bow. Coming from 15 years in an automotive design and development environment he tackled this engineering project with the same skillset and advanced software used in that industry. Here are the design criteria he set.

Design Criteria

  • Be made in the USA
  • 31” Maximum draw
  • Be ambidextrous
  • Must not stack
  • Fit into a standard 22" (559mm) backpack
  • Weigh between 2.4 and 2.8lbs (1,09 and 1.27kg)
  • Be durable
  • Be corrosion resistant and weather proof
  • Accept sites, quiver and arrows rests
  • Be shot with fingers or a release
  • Be shot off the shelf or off an arrow rest
  • Shoot quietly

 

THE SPECIFICATIONS

After all was said and done and the first prototypes came off the production line we ended up with a bow that met all our design criteria and we were happy with every aspect of it. It had surpassed our expectations.

The final design is a riser and limb set that both measure 22" and fit into most standard day-packs. Our bows will be manufactured at our factory in Kentucky, USA and will use corrosion resistant components throughout.

The Ranger Takedown Survival Bow - Aerospace grade aluminum riser, hi-tech composite limbs, carbon end plates and 316 stainless steel screws.

 

The riser is made from an aerospace grade T6 aluminum and can be shot both left and right handed simply by swapping the limbs around prior to stringing. Our structural simulation software, Creo, has shown that the riser is theoretically capable of "lasting a lifetime" unless you are capable of shooting many millions of shots in your time. The below image shows one of our structural computer simulations of a bow at 31" draw and over 70# of draw force. The colors indicate that this bow sees low stresses when compared to the strength of material chosen for the final production.

Finite Element Analysis run using our advanced structural software showing low stresses under extreme draw force.

 

The limbs are made from the same high-tech composite material that we have been using since 2014 and that are also used on most US made compound bows in the market. To date we have (touch wood) not heard of any of our limbs failing in the field. Note: These special limbs must be used together with an endless loop B-50 Dacron string so as to fit correctly into the string groove on the rear of the riser. Our limbs are not compatible with flemish twist or other larger diameter strings.

The Ranger's Limbs are manufacture using a US made hi-tech composite material we have used since 2014 and which can be found on many of the US made compound bows on the market today.

 

The total package weighs in at around 2.6lbs (draw weight dependent) and is able to accept sites, quivers and arrow rests using the ATA standard for mounting and threads.

Ranger Specifications

 

THE OPPORTUNITY - "WITH YOUR HELP WE CAN DO IT!"

In order to prove the concept we had to make the initial investment into the riser and limb production tooling, which was the major expense of this project. Now that we are happy with the bows performance and durability, we need your help to complete all the other parts that will refine and round the bow off.

Your pledge will go directly into the manufacture of the molds and tooling required to produce these parts on a volume scale, as well as invest in the minimum order quantities for limbs. We have most of it covered, but need that last little bit of help from our backers.

If things go really well and we far exceed our campaign goals then we plan on adding some extras poundages for 40# and 45# limbs ($15,000 investment per poundage). These we will add as per the stretch goals below so you pledge now may help us achieve those goals. As you can see, MADE IN THE USA is not cheap!!!

Help us to get this project over its last hurdle and bring this awesome bow to life so we can help adventurers around the world spend more time in those hard to get to places few have ever been.

 

THE REWARDS

Available rewards - See poundage availability as well as Stretch Goals and how they work below if you require a 40# or 45#.

 

Choosing a reward is pretty straight forward and involves 2 STEPS:

STEP 1. Start by choosing your desired package from the list of rewards. 50# and 55# bows are initial available options, but if we reach the stretch goals below, the 45# and then the 40# bows will become available. See further info under "AVAILABLE POUNDAGE OPTIONS" below on how this works.

STEP 2. Add extra accessories to your order by choosing the perks just before checking out. The accessories page also scrolls to the right for more options.

AVAILABLE POUNDAGE OPTIONS

We have 2 initial poundage options available: 50# and 55# all measured at 28" draw. Every person is different and the poundage you choose will depend on a number of factors including your height, strength, level of fitness, years of archery experience, etc. Depending on how much we raise we also have stretch goals for 45# and 40# as detailed below.

Here are some general guidelines to help you choose your poundage if you are totally new to archery.

  • Accuracy is the goal: This may sound silly, but what we mean by this is that everything you do in archery must allow you to shoot accurately. So when choosing a bow the first thing to consider is which bow poundage will allow you to shoot the most accurately. The answer to that is somewhat simple, but also somewhat complicated.
  • Don't try be a hero (even though you may already be one): Archery is more about consistency than brute force. A heavier poundage bow does not always mean a better more accurate bow. The most accurate poundage is the poundage you can comfortably hold at full draw without straining and shaking. The less you strain and shake the easier it is to hold your shot on target and the more consistent you will be.
  • A lower poundage allows for better form: The lower the poundage the easier it is for you to develop correct form and technique. And the better your form and technique the more accurate you will be. If your poundage is too heavy then you may develop poor form from using incorrect muscle groups to draw your bow and that will affect accuracy too.
  • Draw length: Lastly, bows are rated at 28" of draw. That means that a 50# bow will have a force of 50# on your finger when you draw the bow to 28" measured from 2" in front of the throat of the grip (more or less the front of the riser). A good approximation for draw length can be found by measuring the distance in inches from fingertip to fingertip with your arms stretched out either side of you and then dividing that measurement by 2.5. If you are above 28" you have a longer than average draw and below you have a shorter than average draw.

 

If you have a longer than average draw you will pull the bow back further than a shorter draw archer. A longer draw archer will therefore experience more force than a shorter archer with the same poundage bow. It is for this reason that we suggest that longer draw archers new to the sport err on the side of caution and choose a lower poundage than suggested for a medium draw archer.

On the same note a shorter draw archer will draw the bow less and therefore experience less force than a medium draw archer. So, he may be able to go a little up on the poundage.

At the end of the day it is important for you to choose a poundage that works for you and for the activities you choose to enjoy with your bow. If you are able to get to an archery store and try out a recurve or longbow to help you decide then that would be ideal. Don't get your poundage for a compound bow, as a compound bow is totally different because it has "let-off" at full draw, which means a compound bow of a similar rating is much easier to hold at full draw than a longbow or recurve bow. If you can't get to a store, then here is our very broad guideline to help you choose. This is for archers of a medium height corresponding to the weights given here. 

Ranger Ballpark Poundage Suggestions

 

STRETCH GOAL #1 - 45# BOWS AT $50,000

Should we reach a campaign goal of $50,000 we will add Stretch Goal #1 to the project to help bring the 45# bow option to life. This will show up as an option once we reach this goal.

To help us achieve this we ask you as a potential 45# bow backer to pledge now already to raise the campaign total. You can place an order now for a 50# or 55# bow and then either:

  1. update your pledge to the 45# version once we add it (only if we reach $50,000 or more) - it's an easy process, or,
  2. cancel your pledge before the end of the 30 day campaign if we do not reach $50,000, unless you still want to keep the higher poundage bow you initially chose.

To further help us, please share this campaign using the social media share button above so we can reach these stretch goals and bring the left hand version to life.

 

STRETCH GOAL #2 - 40# BOWS AT $80,000

Should we reach a campaign goal of $80,000 we will add Stretch Goal #2 to the project to help bring the 40# bow option to life. This will show up as an option once we reach this goal.

To help us achieve this we ask you as a potential 40# bow backer to pledge now already to raise the campaign total. You can place an order now for a 50# or 55# bow and then either:

  1. update your pledge to the 40# version once we add it (only if we reach $80,000 or more) - it's an easy process, or,
  2. cancel your pledge before the end of the 30 day campaign if we do not reach $80,000, unless you still want to keep the higher poundage bow you initially chose.

To further help us, please share this campaign using the social media share button above so we can reach these stretch goals and bring the left hand version to life.

 

AVAILABLE ACCESSORIES 

Whether you like to keep it simple and shoot off the shelf or are used to shooting a bow with all the bells and whistles, we have you covered with some accessories from both ourselves and Truglo.

If you would like any of these simply add them to your checkout cart once you have chosen your reward. The accessories also scroll to the right so be sure to check them all out during perk add-on.

SAFETY NOTE: We strongly suggest you make use of an arm guard and a finger tab or shooting glove to protect your fingers from string friction and your forearm from string slap. And of course, ALWAYS WEAR SAFETY GLASSES WHEN ENJOYING ARCHERY.

 

Survival Archery Systems Takedown Arrows - 3 Pack - ADD $60

3 Pack of SAS Takedown Arrows - ADD $60

Precision Fit Marine Grade 316 Stainless Steel Insert

 

Our SAS arrows start out as an Easton XX75 Gamegetter Aluminum Shaft. We then get to cutting, cleaning, fletching, epoxing and at the end of this long and expensive process out pops what is classed by many as the best takedown arrow on the market. Aluminum is simply a safer option for a takedown arrows and our testing proved this so decisively that we abandoned the carbon arrows we had developed. These arrows are not cheap, but considering they are made in the USA and with all the work that goes into making them they certainly are value for money.

 

  • 31" long
  • 7075 T9 Aluminum shaft
  • 316 Stainless steel connector
  • Easton Diamond Vanes
  • Combo points included

 

Bear Weather Rest Right Hand - ADD $10

Bear Weather Rest (Right Handed) - ADD $10

 

  • The Weatherest, by Bear Archery.
  • Installs quickly and easily.
  • Weather resistant.

 

This pad will be required if you prefer to shoot arrows with vanes rather than feather fletchings. It will be stuck directly to the riser. Note that this may cause the arrows to sit ever so slightly higher during transport mode and therefore not 100% flush as compared to when no arrow rest is present. One option would be to use a velcro backing and your arrow rest of choice.

 

Spare 60" B-50 Dacron String - ADD $15

OMP 60" B-50 Dacron String - ADD $15

 

Neet Vented Armguard (Black) - ADD $15

Neet Vented Armguard Black - ADD $15

 

  • A popular full-sized, ventilated arm guard
  • 6 1/2 inches long
  • Comfortable poly-fiber backed elastic straps with velcro fasteners
  • Three nylon rod reinforcement staves
  • Suitable for left and right handed archers

 

Truglo Carbon Hybrid 5 Pin 19 (Black) - ADD $88

Truglo Carbon Hybrid MIC 5 Pin 19 (Black) - ADD $88

 

HYPER•STRIKE™ combines fan-favorite features with new innovations in the world of bow sights. Decreasing Diameter Pins increase accuracy at longer ranges, while the TRU•LITE™ PRO rotary light illuminates your pins to extend your hunt through crucial low light prime–time. With multiple mounting positions, the MAXAMOUNT™ bracket provides more setup options than ever before.

  • Lightweight carbon composite and aluminum construction
  • Micro–adjustable windage and elevation
  • 2nd and 3rd axis adjustable level
  • Extra–long fibers for maximum brightness
  • Large circular field of view (1.9 in. dia.)
  • Decreasing Diameter Pin (DDP) design uses smaller pins for longer distances
  • MAXAMOUNT™ bracket offers three sight radius positions with high / low mounting holes for numerous mounting options
  • Unique PRO•BRITE™ pin design for increased durability and brightness
  • Glow–in–the–dark shooter’s ring
  • TRU•TOUCH™ soft–feel technical coating
  • Adjustable for left and right–handed shooters
  • Patented

 

Truglo Tru-Tec LT Quiver (Black) - ADD $51 

Truglo Tru-Tec LT Quiver (Black) - ADD $51

 

  • Ultra–lightweight aluminum construction
  • Weighs less than 10 oz.
  • Interchangeable colored vibration–dampening inserts
  • POSITIVE•LOCK mounting bracket
  • Smooth, one–hand removal
  • Hanging loop for treestands or ground blinds
  • Mounting bracket adjusts up / down to better fit all bows
  • Rubber hood insert reduces noise and won’t dull broadheads
  • Fits both carbon and aluminum arrows
  • Fits both mechanical and fixed–blade broadheads
  • Fits both left and right–handed bows
  • TRU•TOUCH™ soft–feel technical coating
  • Patented

 

THE TIMELINE

The good news is that in order to develop our prototypes we had to invest in the tooling required for the riser and limb manufacturing up front. So the bulk of the project is already paid for AND the long lead-time items are already complete as you can see from our video showing the prototype parts which are off tool.

The rest of the small parts and processes are easy parts of the project and production will start once we reach our funding goal and will follow the timing below. As you can see, we have been working for quite some time on this and are pretty much done.

Current Project Timeline

 

NOTE: Depending on the number of backers please note that bows will start to be fulfilled in July, but some of the later orders may only go out at a later date as manufacturing capability allows.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

In all honesty I have decided to pull the launch of this bow forward by about 3 months due to the current COVID-19 pandemic. Over the past 2 months we have been full steam ahead producing our current line of bows as there are a lot of customers who are concerned that food security may become an issue as the pandemic progresses over the months ahead. Whilst I am not a fan of spreading fear I do understand that this may be of concern going forward. This is the reason for releasing the bow now as it is a cheaper option as compared to our current bows and therefore allows more people to access a compact bow option and because it allows for sites, it affords many the option of being less skilled with a bow than if no sites could be fitted. I have spoken to all my manufacturers and the current situation as at launch is that all of them will remain open for the foreseeable future. There is however a risk that this may change, although I am unable to quantify the probability of the risk. I think we all understand why. My aim is to start manufacturing as soon as I hit the $10,000 goal which will hopefully be in the early part of the campaign, so if all my suppliers remain open we should be able to fulfill orders according to the July timing. Also, because we have already made the major investments into the main production tooling and have production level risers and limbs already approved for production, it is only the small parts such as the logo plates as well as some refinement with our decorators that we need to iron out. These are the easy parts to produce and thus there is virtually no risk from a design and manufacturability point of view. We already have all our suppliers waiting for the go-ahead to put the parts into production for us. All we need is your help in backing this project to get the final small-part tooling made. With over 19 years as a design engineer and project manager I have no doubt in the suppliers I have chosen and their ability to deliver to the quality I expect from my automotive production background. These are longstanding suppliers I have used for years. I personally guarantee you that if we get the funding we will deliver a quality product to you. Back our project and help us to bring this project to completion. To do so simply choose one of our rewards above and let us do the rest. Thank you for taking the time to view our project! Our team has worked hard so we hope you enjoyed it! To back our project choose one of the rewards of your choice.

 

LONG LASTING DESIGN

We have designed the product using advanced structural software to ensure the product only experiences stresses below its material fatigue limit and thus it is deemed designed for what engineers call "infinite life". Using the same design principles and trusted software I used during my career as an automotive design engineer I have created a product that is both safe and durable. To date, we have not received any warranty returns from our current archery products since our company launch in 2014 and trust this product will show the same success.

 

A NOTE FROM OUR DIRECTOR

My name is Doug Shadwell and I am the founder and director of Survival Archery Systems which is situated in the heart of the Bluegrass in Lexington, Kentucky, USA.

Survival Archery Systems - Established 2014 and situated in Lexington, Kentucky, USA.

 

After a 14 year career as an automotive design engineer and project manager and having worked all over the world, I decided to pursue my own business in product development. I launched my first product under Survival Archery Systems which has been in business since 2014 and our current products are considered by many as the premium brand in their niche of compact folding bows. We also introduced a compact takedown bow, the Atmos, which serves the goal of taking us more into the regular side of archery so that we can increase our market share with all the products we have planned for the future. 

Our products are proudly made in America by American hands who share our passion for archery. A simple Google search for Survival Archery Systems or SAS  Survival Bow will will give you a good idea of our existing range. You may also visit our website at www.survivalarcherysystems.com for more info and details on what we do. 

Doug Shadwell - Behind his design station where he enjoys things most.

 

I would like to thank you up front for backing our project if you do and invite you to contact me anytime during this campaign should you have any questions. I will personally be answering your questions so look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,

Doug Shadwell

Every person is different and the poundage you choose will depend on a number of factors including your height, strength, level of fitness, years of archery experience, etc. Depending on how much we raise we also have stretch goals for 45# and 40# as detailed below.Here are some general guidelines to help you choose your poundage if you are totally new to archery.

Accuracy is the goal: This may sound silly, but what we mean by this is that everything you do in archery must allow you to shoot accurately. So when choosing a bow the first thing to consider is which bow poundage will allow you to shoot the most accurately. The answer to that is somewhat simple, but also somewhat complicated.

Don't try be a hero (even though you may already be one): Archery is more about consistency than brute force. A heavier poundage bow does not always mean a better more accurate bow. The most accurate poundage is the poundage you can comfortably hold at full draw without straining and shaking. The less you strain and shake the easier it is to hold your shot on target and the more consistent you will be.

A lower poundage allows for better form: The lower the poundage the easier it is for you to develop correct form and technique. And the better your form and technique the more accurate you will be. If your poundage is too heavy then you may develop poor form from using incorrect muscle groups to draw your bow and that will affect accuracy too.

Draw length: Lastly, bows are rated at 28" of draw. That means that a 50# bow will have a force of 50# on your finger when you draw the bow to 28" measured from 2" in front of the throat of the grip (more or less the front of the riser). A good approximation for draw length can be found by measuring the distance in inches from fingertip to fingertip with your arms stretched out either side of you and then dividing that measurement by 2.5. If you are above 28" you have a longer than average draw and below you have a shorter than average draw.
 If you have a longer than average draw you will pull the bow back further than a shorter draw archer. A longer draw archer will therefore experience more force than a shorter archer with the same poundage bow. It is for this reason that we suggest that longer draw archers new to the sport err on the side of caution and choose a lower poundage than suggested for a medium draw archer.On the same note a shorter draw archer will draw the bow less and therefore experience less force than a medium draw archer. So, he may be able to go a little up on the poundage.At the end of the day it is important for you to choose a poundage that works for you and for the activities you choose to enjoy with your bow. If you are able to get to an archery store and try out a recurve or longbow to help you decide then that would be ideal. Don't get your poundage for a compound bow, as a compound bow is totally different because it has "let-off" at full draw, which means a compound bow of a similar rating is much easier to hold at full draw than a longbow or recurve bow. If you can't get to a store, then here is our very broad guideline to help you choose. This is for archers of a medium height corresponding to the weights given here. Ranger Ballpark Poundage Suggestions STRETCH GOAL #1 - 45# BOWS AT $50,000Should we reach a campaign goal of $50,000 we will add Stretch Goal #1 to the project to help bring the 45# bow option to life. This will show up as an option once we reach this goal.To help us achieve this we ask you as a potential 45# bow backer to pledge now already to raise the campaign total. You can place an order now for a 50# or 55# bow and then either:
update your pledge to the 45# version once we add it (only if we reach $50,000 or more) - it's an easy process, or,
cancel your pledge before the end of the 30 day campaign if we do not reach $50,000, unless you still want to keep the higher poundage bow you initially chose.
To further help us, please share this campaign using the social media share button above so we can reach these stretch goals and bring the left hand version to life. STRETCH GOAL #2 - 40# BOWS AT $80,000Should we reach a campaign goal of $80,000 we will add Stretch Goal #2 to the project to help bring the 40# bow option to life. This will show up as an option once we reach this goal.To help us achieve this we ask you as a potential 40# bow backer to pledge now already to raise the campaign total. You can place an order now for a 50# or 55# bow and then either:
update your pledge to the 40# version once we add it (only if we reach $80,000 or more) - it's an easy process, or,
cancel your pledge before the end of the 30 day campaign if we do not reach $80,000, unless you still want to keep the higher poundage bow you initially chose.
To further help us, please share this campaign using the social media share button above so we can reach these stretch goals and bring the left hand version to life. AVAILABLE ACCESSORIES Whether you like to keep it simple and shoot off the shelf or are used to shooting a bow with all the bells and whistles, we have you covered with some accessories from both ourselves and Truglo.If you would like any of these simply add them to your checkout cart once you have chosen your reward. The accessories also scroll to the right so be sure to check them all out during perk add-on.SAFETY NOTE: We strongly suggest you make use of an arm guard and a finger tab or shooting glove to protect your fingers from string friction and your forearm from string slap. And of course, ALWAYS WEAR SAFETY GLASSES WHEN ENJOYING ARCHERY. Survival Archery Systems Takedown Arrows - 3 Pack - ADD $603 Pack of SAS Takedown Arrows - ADD $60Precision Fit Marine Grade 316 Stainless Steel Insert Our SAS arrows start out as an Easton XX75 Gamegetter Aluminum Shaft. We then get to cutting, cleaning, fletching, epoxing and at the end of this long and expensive process out pops what is classed by many as the best takedown arrow on the market. Aluminum is simply a safer option for a takedown arrows and our testing proved this so decisively that we abandoned the carbon arrows we had developed. These arrows are not cheap, but considering they are made in the USA and with all the work that goes into making them they certainly are value for money.

 This pad will be required if you prefer to shoot arrows with vanes rather than feather fletchings. It will be stuck directly to the riser. Note that this may cause the arrows to sit ever so slightly higher during transport mode and therefore not 100% flush as compared to when no arrow rest is present. One option would be to use a velcro backing and your arrow rest of choice. Spare 60" B-50 Dacron String - ADD $15OMP 60" B-50 Dacron String - ADD $15 Neet Vented Armguard (Black) - ADD $15Neet Vented Armguard Black - ADD $15

Decreasing Diameter Pins increase accuracy at longer ranges, while the TRU•LITE™ PRO rotary light illuminates your pins to extend your hunt through crucial low light prime–time. With multiple mounting positions, the MAXAMOUNT™ bracket provides more setup options than ever before.

 THE TIMELINEThe good news is that in order to develop our prototypes we had to invest in the tooling required for the riser and limb manufacturing up front. So the bulk of the project is already paid for AND the long lead-time items are already complete as you can see from our video showing the prototype parts which are off tool.The rest of the small parts and processes are easy parts of the project and production will start once we reach our funding goal and will follow the timing below. As you can see, we have been working for quite some time on this and are pretty much done.Current Project Timeline NOTE: Depending on the number of backers please note that bows will start to be fulfilled in July, but some of the later orders may only go out at a later date as manufacturing capability allows. RISKS AND CHALLENGESIn all honesty I have decided to pull the launch of this bow forward by about 3 months due to the current COVID-19 pandemic. Over the past 2 months we have been full steam ahead producing our current line of bows as there are a lot of customers who are concerned that food security may become an issue as the pandemic progresses over the months ahead. Whilst I am not a fan of spreading fear I do understand that this may be of concern going forward. This is the reason for releasing the bow now as it is a cheaper option as compared to our current bows and therefore allows more people to access a compact bow option and because it allows for sites, it affords many the option of being less skilled with a bow than if no sites could be fitted. I have spoken to all my manufacturers and the current situation as at launch is that all of them will remain open for the foreseeable future. There is however a risk that this may change, although I am unable to quantify the probability of the risk. I think we all understand why. My aim is to start manufacturing as soon as I hit the $10,000 goal which will hopefully be in the early part of the campaign, so if all my suppliers remain open we should be able to fulfill orders according to the July timing. Also, because we have already made the major investments into the main production tooling and have production level risers and limbs already approved for production, it is only the small parts such as the logo plates as well as some refinement with our decorators that we need to iron out. These are the easy parts to produce and thus there is virtually no risk from a design and manufacturability point of view. We already have all our suppliers waiting for the go-ahead to put the parts into production for us. All we need is your help in backing this project to get the final small-part tooling made. With over 19 years as a design engineer and project manager I have no doubt in the suppliers I have chosen and their ability to deliver to the quality I expect from my automotive production background. These are longstanding suppliers I have used for years. I personally guarantee you that if we get the funding we will deliver a quality product to you. Back our project and help us to bring this project to completion. To do so simply choose one of our rewards above and let us do the rest. Thank you for taking the time to view our project! Our team has worked hard so we hope you enjoyed it! To back our project choose one of the rewards of your choice. LONG LASTING DESIGNWe have designed the product using advanced structural software to ensure the product only experiences stresses below its material fatigue limit and thus it is deemed designed for what engineers call "infinite life". Using the same design principles and trusted software I used during my career as an automotive design engineer I have created a product that is both safe and durable. To date, we have not received any warranty returns from our current archery products since our company launch in 2014 and trust this product will show the same success. A NOTE FROM OUR DIRECTORMy name is Doug Shadwell and I am the founder and director of Survival Archery Systems which is situated in the heart of the Bluegrass in Lexington, Kentucky, USA.Survival Archery Systems - Established 2014 and situated in Lexington, Kentucky, USA. After a 14 year career as an automotive design engineer and project manager and having worked all over the world, I decided to pursue my own business in product development. I launched my first product under Survival Archery Systems which has been in business since 2014 and our current products are considered by many as the premium brand in their niche of compact folding bows. We also introduced a compact takedown bow, the Atmos, which serves the goal of taking us more into the regular side of archery so that we can increase our market share with all the products we have planned for the future. Our products are proudly made in America by American hands who share our passion for archery. A simple Google search for Survival Archery Systems or SAS  Survival Bow will will give you a good idea of our existing range. You may also visit our website at www.survivalarcherysystems.com for more info and details on what we do. Doug Shadwell - Behind his design station where he enjoys things most. I would like to thank you up front for backing our project if you do and invite you to contact me anytime during this campaign should you have any questions. I will personally be answering your questions so look forward to hearing from you.Best regards,Doug Shadwell

story:
Most of people carry pen every single day, but you might rarely have a pair of scissors or a cutter with you because many existing products are way too heavy, ugly, or you'd be accidentally stabbed by the exposed blade. However, you do need to cut or trim something at times, then you won't really prepare well for everything if you miss scissors.

After the executions of three successful projects – Tool Pen, Tool Pen mini, WRENCHit, we have never stopped creating more designs or inventions for making our life easier and improved. Now, let us introduce our new idea Xcissor Pen - a super innovative & perfect solution lets you handily keep one workable scissors on the go. It's an elegant yet powerful executive pen, as the essential attribute of your everyday life!

First of all, Xcissor Pen is a true writing instrument. It sports the high-quality and beefy SUS304 Stainless Steel with a smooth luxurious finish in the understated style. This solid construction will guarantee your pen is indestructible and have the better protection against dings & dents, as well as shielding ink cartridges. Thanks to the slight streamlined shape, Xcissor Pen is perfectly balanced and feels like a natural extension of your hands while you hold it.

The ink cartridge is interchangeable, it’s meticulously crafted and infinitely replaced with the international standard D1 size refills, means it will last you a lifetime. Writing with Xcissor Pen is an absolute joy, you can sign anything with a flourish!

The blade of scissors is made from strong SUS420 Stainless Steel for excellent edge retention and resistance to corrosion, it can cut through many materials such as paper, threads, cloths, leathers, wood chips… all normal duties with ease. The scissors are hidden in the barrel that is opposite to the writing end, so it offers protection against stabbing your pockets or bags. All you need is rapidly draw the scissors from the barrel, slide one shank from the Safety Lock with a thumb, and you’re ready to go!

What's more, the dapper shank also offers a natural thumb rest for a forward grip. It’s incredibly compact, handy, safe, and functional that allows for effortless utility cutting.

Everything in our design is ambidextrous, so the pen & scissors work for both left- and right-handed users, fit every one of all ages and all sizes of hands.

One more thing, we provide two colors of pen "Silver" & "Black", and two types of finish of scissors blade - "Nickle plated" & "Teflon coated" for your selection. The Nickle plating enhances the prevention of corrosion, and Teflon coating generates a suitable non-stick exterior; either one will make the scissors blade insanely durable and easier to maintain.

Xcissor Pen is a real one-of-a-kind showstopper that makes you smart & stylish. It's the ultimate in simplicity, each piece is precision machined & polished, you’ll appreciate its lightweight (~ 60 g) but sturdy constructions. The scissors will be easily concealed in a pocket, jacket, or bag, in case of any circumstances that something you want to cut, trim, or snip off.

Xcissor Pen is an ideal essential for general purpose use at home, office, workshop, or doing any adventures outdoors. Everyone will agree it's a fabulous pen, and we believe it shall WOW all people when it’s demonstrated. It'll certainly be a must-have EDC with you everywhere!

To make your Xcissor Pen more powerful, we have also published a whole new design – Interchangeable Art Knife Module switched with the pen nib. You can be free to decide on having your pen 2-in-1 (“Ballpoint Pen + Scissors” ; “Art Knife + Scissors”) or 3-in-1 (Ballpoint Pen + Art Knife + Scissors) as you wish.

Note: Because all items with blades (scissors, knives...) are not allowed to ship by postal mails, we'll ship your rewards via express services (ex - UPS, DHL, FedEx....), so every reward would be added additional $10 shipping fee. Since our products are made in Taiwan and shipped from Taiwan, the actual shipping cost via express is much higher than $10 no matter where they will be delivered, which means we absorb some expenses at our side.

This project is the toughest one we had ever made so far, we spent more than 6 months for 5-runs prototyping. One of the main challenges is to create a tiny but complicated structure of the cutting mechanism & safety lock feature, not to mention we implement and hide the whole scissors inside a very small space of pen barrel. As you could imagine, it requires the precision machining process of tooling, lathing, milling, polishing, grinding… in every detail, especially stainless steel is a difficult-to-machine material due to its hardness and metal properties.

Fortunately, we lined up a great manufacturing team, headed by a maker with 20+ years of luxury-pen experience, every party in this supply chain was striving for solving problems, and never gave up on doing improvements. After 4-run failed prototypes and repeated adjustments, we finally come out a workable one with optimized mechanical design & renewed machining methods. Now, let’s take this amazing Xcissor Pen into reality!

We are team “mininch” (pronounced by “mini-inch”). We have rolled out many ideas from prior Tool Pen trilogy to this recent-launch Xcissor Pen through crowdfunding community. We aim to forge our own inventive paths with everything unique & creative, also make all designs with simplicity as a guideline. Out goal is to give backers a pleasant experience of the excellent products & services.

story:
Shipping now


Cleaning from your environment, ROCKUBOT is your safety buddy, the cool and cutting-edge robot that focuses entirely on keeping you safe and healthy in your home or hotels.

 

Equipped with 24 smart sensors, the ROCKUBOT is able to avoid obstacles, overcome terrains, and detect any cliffs. 

Auto Sensor on Top

Likewise, the cliff sensors prevent ROCKUBOT from taking any high falls. 

With the innovative technology, ROCKUBOT boasts its smart mapping and navigation which allows the robot to adapt any environment to clean the bed and room properly with ease. 

ROCKUBOT is a music-playing robot with Bluetooth 5.0, you can enjoy your favorite music while sanitizing. That's why we call it ROCKUBOT.  When two ROCKUBOT is paired together, one will play the left channel and the other plays the right. This is made possible thanks to the TWS (True Wireless Stereo) for the two speaker-stereo pairing.

Let ROCKUBOT Rock the World!

ROCKUBOT also comes with a 5200mAh battery charging function. With its sleek and compact design, ROCKUBOT can be used as a power bank to charge your device on the go. 

Charging wirelessly and fitting into any backpack or suitcase, ROCKUBOT is the convenient cleaning option that goes where you go without any extra effort.

Shipping now




Cleaning from your environment, ROCKUBOT is your safety buddy, the cool and cutting-edge robot that focuses entirely on keeping you safe and healthy in your home or hotels.
 Equipped with 24 smart sensors, the ROCKUBOT is able to avoid obstacles, overcome terrains, and detect any cliffs. Auto Sensor on TopLikewise, the cliff sensors prevent ROCKUBOT from taking any high falls. With the innovative technology, ROCKUBOT boasts its smart mapping and navigation which allows the robot to adapt any environment to clean the bed and room properly with ease. ROCKUBOT is a music-playing robot with Bluetooth 5.0, you can enjoy your favorite music while sanitizing. That's why we call it ROCKUBOT.  When two ROCKUBOT is paired together, one will play the left channel and the other plays the right. This is made possible thanks to the TWS (True Wireless Stereo) for the two speaker-stereo pairing.Let ROCKUBOT Rock the World! ROCKUBOT also comes with a 5200mAh battery charging function. With its sleek and compact design, ROCKUBOT can be used as a power bank to charge your device on the go. Charging wirelessly and fitting into any backpack or suitcase, ROCKUBOT is the convenient cleaning option that goes where you go without any extra effort.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brynne Harvey. I am a freshman at Louisiana State University. 

Mission: Hope for Moldova is a charity I have founded that supports orphans in the Eastern European country of Moldova. We work with a church planting organization, Moldova for Christ.

This summer we are trying to send 100 orphans to camp! This could be a life changing experience for these orphans as they learn about the love of God and have a good time being children. 

What We Need & What You Get

1 Orphan for 1 Week of Summer Camp Costs $120

Each donation will go towards summer camp expenses for the orphans and/or volunteers (from Moldova).


The Impact

Mission: Hope for Moldova's long-term goal is to start a transitional care home for orphans that are 16+ years old. This will prevent them from being homeless and vulnerable for human trafficking. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially please pray for us as we ask God to provide these funds! Also, please share our link on social media!

Also, please share our link on social media!

story:
We are an italian students group who have built two robots able to play soccer.

We partecipated at the italian competition of robotics "RomeCup Jr. 2014" and got the third place which allowed us to join the World Championship in Brazil: "Robocup Jr. 2014".


Siamo un gruppo di studenti italiani che ha costruito due robot capaci di giocare a calcio. Abbiamo partecipato alla competizione italiana di robotica "Romecup Jr. 2014" e ci siamo classificati terzi, consentendo al gruppo di partecipare al campionato mondiale in Brasile "Robocup Jr. 2014"

Our project began on november 2013. We worked hard for four days a week and over to build our robots and programming them. After four months we got ready: our robots were able to play!


Il nostro progetto è iniziato a Novembre nel 2013, ci siamo dedicati alla costruzione dei robot e alla programmazione per quattro giorni a settimana e oltre. Dopo quattro mesi tutto fu pronto e i nostri robot erano in grado di giocare!

We have built our robots with PSoC5 Cypress cy8ckit 050 and created some printed circute boards by ourselves.

Abbiamo costruito i nostri robot con PSoC5 Cypress cy8ckit 050 e creato delle schede elettriche da noi con programmi e macchinari vari.

Now we need help to collect money for travelling, staying in Brazil and try to win again. We are determinated to do it!

The RobotCup Jr. 2014 will start on july the 21st.

Ora abbiamo bisogno di aiuto e raccogliere fondi per andare in Brasile,              soggiornarci e cercare di vincere di nuovo. Siamo determinati a farcela!   

Il campionato "Robocup Jr. 2014" inizierà il 21 Giugno.  

                        PLEASE GIVE US YOUR HELP!!!                           

PER FAVORE DATECI IL VOSTRO SOSTEGNO!!!

After four months we got ready: our robots were able to play!Il nostro progetto è iniziato a Novembre nel 2013, ci siamo dedicati alla costruzione dei robot e alla programmazione per quattro giorni a settimana e oltre. Dopo quattro mesi tutto fu pronto e i nostri robot erano in grado di giocare!We have built our robots with PSoC5 Cypress cy8ckit 050 and created some printed circute boards by ourselves.Abbiamo costruito i nostri robot con PSoC5 Cypress cy8ckit 050 e creato delle schede elettriche da noi con programmi e macchinari vari.Now we need help to collect money for travelling, staying in Brazil and try to win again. We are determinated to do it!The RobotCup Jr. 2014 will start on july the 21st.Ora abbiamo bisogno di aiuto e raccogliere fondi per andare in Brasile,              soggiornarci e cercare di vincere di nuovo. Siamo determinati a farcela!   Il campionato "Robocup Jr. 2014" inizierà il 21 Giugno.                          PLEASE GIVE US YOUR HELP!!!                           PER FAVORE DATECI IL VOSTRO SOSTEGNO!!!

story:
Inspiration

Like many stories, this one started with a bottle of champagne--our first thought after coming across Veuve Clicquot’s beautiful tangerine cover was that we wished we had more reasons to walk around with a bottle of champagne in hand.  Our second thought was, why should champagne have all the fun?  We set out to create a similar jacket for a regular water bottle.  It soon became clear that the concept offered more than just creating a pretty bottle cover, instead we might just be able to create a new kind of water bottle.


A New Kind of Bottle

Bend Bottle combines a stylish and functional insulating jacket with a flexible silicone bottle.  The result is a new kind of bottle that’s exceptionally packable, easy to carry, and convenient to drink from.

Designed to Go with You

 Bend Bottle's unique attributes make it particularly well suited for life-on-the-go.    Light and soft, you can grab it by the handle or finger loop.  Hands full?  No problem--one finger it and head out the door.  Drinking is extra easy with a flip spout that’s covered when not in use.  It fits most cup holders and the quick access spout means you can safely drink and drive.  Quiet and spill-resistant, it's at home in the office, classroom, or gym.  If you're on the move, loop, cradle, or clip it and carry your water in comfort.   Perfect for travel, it squashes flat for packing. Soft and quiet, there's no“clunk” and it won’t break or dent when dropped.  Work, play, or somewhere in between, Bend Bottle is the hydration solution for active lifestyles. 

Features

Designed to offer what other bottles can't, Bend Bottle includes a range of thoughtful features.

The unique flip spout seals off fluid flow when it's folded-over.  The spout is generously sized and offers sipping or pouring for full volume flow.  A magnetic cover keeps the spout protected when not in use, yet provides easy access.  Magnets front and back keep the cover closed or held open for drinking. The jacket exterior uses luggage-grade ballistic nylon to provide durable protection for the inner bottle.  An interior insulating layer keeps water cold. 

The jacket includes an integrated handle, loop, and clip hook, offering multiple options for carrying the bottle. The finger loop can be wrapped over the mouthpiece cover to provide extra secure sealing.  The 63 mm screw cap port at the base facilitates filling and cleaning and its wide mouth handles ice cubes readily. 

Bend Bottle is just as good on the inside as it is on the outside.  The food-grade silicone bottle is dishwasher safe and contains no BPA, PVC, or other harmful additives.  The silicone interior imparts no plastic taste so your water always tastes fresh.  The  large bore top and bottom openings make cleaning especially easy.   It's dishwasher and freezer safe. 

Join us to Make Bend Bottle Happen

This is Mazama Designs first crowdfunding project and we're excited about the opportunity to involve our customers in bringing Bend Bottle to market. We're reaching out through Indiegogo to enlist your help in perfecting the Bend Bottle and kickstarting its production.   To date, we've developed the design from concept to pre-production design, now we're moving forward to manufacture Bend Bottle in larger volumes.   

We're raising funds for production and will use feedback from early backers to shape Bend Bottle's finished design.  We expect to begin manufacture of Bend Bottle in early 2019 and deliver product in May.  Please join us to make a whole new kind of water bottle.

 

Bend Bottle Gives Back

1% of of all campaign funds raised will go to Water.org, an organization that brings safe water safe water and sanitation through access to small, affordable loans. For more than 25 years, Water.org has been providing families worldwide with hope, health and the opportunity to break the cycle of poverty.

Bend Bottle Team

About Mazama Designs

Mazama Designs is an outdoor gear development company committed to providing innovative, high-quality products that will enhance your enjoyment and performance.   Our mission is to keep people hydrated so that they can make the most of their outdoor moments. We’re a group of outdoor enthusiasts and athletes with a passion for improving the gear we use every day. Our testing grounds are just out the back door in the high desert country of Central Oregon, where there’s no shortage of gear challenges.  We've been designing and developing hydration products for over 25 years and today Mazama offers a full line of hydration solutions including comfortable, lightweight packs, easy-fill reservoirs, and innovative accessories. Whether it’s a walk around the block or a wilderness adventure, our products are designed to make your day better.

About Mazama Designs
