story:
What is a World Scout Jamboree?

The World Scout Jamboree is above all an educational event that brings together the world’s young people to promote peace and mutual understanding and to develop leadership and life skills.

The 24th World Scout Jamboree will feature the hallmarks of past world jamboree programs, such as the Global Development Village, the World Scout Centre, a special sustainability initiative, and the socialization elements that allow participants to make lifelong friends from around the world.

Unlike any other youth event, the World Scout Jamboree invites you to surround yourself in diverse global cultures by joining your new Scouting friends at a single destination for 12 unforgettable days. The jamboree experience extends beyond your home—and beyond the boundaries of our countries—to create a global adventure that will last a lifetime!

Who Should Attend

The 24th World Scout Jamboree is an official educational event of the World Organization of the Scout Movement. It is specifically designed for young people ages 14 to 17 years old from National Scout Organizations, which are members of WOSM.

To be eligible to be a youth participant at the 24th World Scout Jamboree, you must be born between 22 July 2001 and 21 July 2005. If you are older on the given date, you may be able to apply to become a member of the International Service Team or contingent team, or a unit leader. The exact age requirements have been approved by the World Scout Committee.

The Jamboree Hosts

This 24th World Scout Jamboree is unique because it is a team effort by Scouts Canada, Asociación de Scouts de México, and the Boy Scouts of America. Our three countries are getting ready to welcome our Scouting friends as family to “Unlock a New World.”

The Theme

Our theme, Unlock a New World, invites you to unlock new adventures, new cultures, and new friendships. The theme was originally designed by youth representatives from our three host countries, also known as the “Dream Team,” who were responsible for presenting the original bid for the 24th World Scout Jamboree. Because our jamboree is being hosted in North America, it will be defined by the cultures found in the “New World” countries of Mexico, Canada, and the USA. This jamboree will provide a different view on the Scouting movement. Holding fast to our traditions of conservation and outdoorsmanship, a jamboree in the New World is a jamboree that embraces the growing trend of leadership development and global citizenship that our movement has cultivated.

The Summit Bechtel Reserve

The Summit Bechtel Reserve is a world class and sustainable Jamboree site and will host the 24th World Scout Jamboree. The Summit Bechtel Reserve is located in West Virginia, USA, and is comprised of more than 14,000 acres (5,667 ha) of beautiful forested mountains adjacent to more than 70,000 acres (28,328 ha) of national park in the scenic New River Gorge area of West Virginia.

The Summit Bechtel Reserve is one of the most environmentally sustainable human habitats ever built for Scouts. The Sustainability Treehouse is a living education center for Scouts, not only providing information, but also immersing Scouts in the concept of sustainability. Between the local timber used to build the structure, the rainwater recovery system and the wind- and solar-generated energy, the Sustainability Treehouse is not just a museum. Standing 126 feet (38.4 m) tall and featuring 4,000 square feet (371.6 square meters) of interactive exhibits, the Treehouse, along with the McAllister Family Sustainability Challenge Trail and other exhibits, will serve as the centerpiece of Scouting’s commitment to leave the world a better place. Sustainable practices will be evident everywhere you look, as they are at the core of the Summit Bechtel Reserves infrastructure, and sustainability will be a core part of the 24th World Scout Jamboree program.

The Weather

The month of July is characterized by warm weather, with daily high temperatures around 79 degrees F/ 26.1 degrees C and daily low temperatures around 62 degrees F/16.6 degrees C, and moderate to high humidity. The site typically experiences partly cloudy conditions during the month with the possibility of thunderstorms and rain showers.

story:
#Support us in our Journey to make Travel more Personalised, Engaging and Interesting for 1.2 Billion International Travellers!

Calling out to all Fellow #Travellers & #Indiegogoans for #Support

Hi Everyone!

This is Nidhi, Vineet, Darshan and the Guiddoo Team who are passionate about travel and have been part of the travel industry for a long time.

Lets start with a story:

I (Nidhi) always wanted to go to the Eiffel Tower with my someone special. After 12 years of flying and numerous trips to Paris finally got to go with my husband Vineet. A trip of a lifetime which I had looked forward to for years suddenly became a trip to forget. In Paris for just two days found out that the Eiffel was closed on Day 1 and on Day 2 had a huge queue, couldn't get a ticket to the summit (others had a direct ticket and didn't need to queue) and missed out seeing the First floor. In Short a trip to forget or "The Lost Trip to Eiffel Tower".

Standing in the Queue and researching later Guiddoo was born - A Personal Mobile Audio-Visual tour guide to know about a location, plan and book your tour need like Monument Tickets and much more.


So what is Guiddoo?

Guiddoo is a Travel Technology Product that wants to disrupt the Tour Guiding and Planning space by providing innovative mobile and handsfree technology which include Mobile Applications, Google Glass and Ocolus Virtual Reality Solutions.

Our travel guides and tour planner will cover the tourism verticals of Monuments, Museums, Tourist Locations, Cruises, Trains, Festivals, Religion, Music Festivals and a lot more over the next 18 months. Frankly speaking we will cater to each and every traveller taste with our content and locations.


What has Guiddoo done so far?



#Support us in our Journey to make Travel more Personalised, Engaging and Interesting!

You can support us in helping us build a travel tool for fellow travellers by adding more content in many languages and tools that can be used for planning and booking. With your #support we can reach 1400+ In-Location points with 12+ verticals which include Museums, Monuments, Tourist Locations, Festivals, Cruises, Rail, Religion, Music Festivals and a lot more.

How do we spend your money and grow Guiddoo?




The Guiddoo Perks for Travellers and Supporters

We need to raise $20,000 for now to make this vision a reality. And yes we will offer great perks to our backers in the form of Travel Coupons that they can use on their future holidays to book hotels, plan travel and other items. These are coupons that you surely will use in your local, national or international trips (Some sample partners given below, more to be added soon) and are not discount vouchers but extended date full validity coupons!!    
Perk Mistake on the RHS: $499 perk will be available from September 2015 and not June 2016        

 

Where can these Coupons be used? 


    What is the vision and future for Guiddoo?

    Guiddoo is a Great Tour Guiding and Planning Product and people who have used it have given great feedback for the same. There is a strong chance that we will disrupt the Tour Guiding Industry and make a great travel tool. But as a startup there are risks including some new "Well Funded" startups entering the field in the last 18 months of us being around. Though risks exist we are confident because we are the Guiddoos - The perfect mix of Vision, Energy and Passion for Travel.


    Finally lets end with a story!

    "I wish I would have borrowed $5,000 and offered it to Dennis in the Foursquare seed round, given that I was helping them tell the story and work their way through the VC process," O'Donnell tells us.
    "I wasn't at a VC fund at the time, but was very tempted to make the offer.  The only problem was that I was $30,000 in the hole from working on my startup and literally didn't have a dime."
     - First Round Capital's Charlie O'Donnell passed on Foursquare because he was broke.
    Source: http://www.businessinsider.com/missed-investment-opportunities-regrets-2011-8?op=1#ixzz3DwrnSaZp


    Looking forward to your

    "SUPPORT" and "SHARE"


    Chances are that you may not have the Cash right now to #support Guiddoo, but you can still make a difference by sharing our proposal with Friends, Family and Others who can help Guiddoo grow and get perks they can actually use in the future!
    Thanks for your time and looking forward to having you on board.
    The Guiddoo Team

Finally lets end with a story!

"I wasn't at a VC fund at the time, but was very tempted to make the offer.  The only problem was that I was $30,000 in the hole from working on my startup and literally didn't have a dime." - First Round Capital's Charlie O'Donnell passed on Foursquare because he was broke.

Looking forward to your
"SUPPORT" and "SHARE"
Chances are that you may not have the Cash right now to #support Guiddoo, but you can still make a difference by sharing our proposal with Friends, Family and Others who can help Guiddoo grow and get perks they can actually use in the future!
Thanks for your time and looking forward to having you on board.The Guiddoo Team

story:
US warehouse in stock, ship out in 3 days
https://geneinno.us/products/geneinno-s1

 

Meet Trident: Your New Underwater Best Friend

Life on Earth began in the ocean. And while we humans grew legs and lost our fishy gills, the ocean calls us to come back and explore. We answered that call with Trident, a streamlined underwater scooter that helps everyone feel at home in the briny deep! Follow your deepsea dreams farther than ever before with Trident, bringing you high performance at a low price.

How do we know Trident is best for you?

Because Trident puts you in charge of your own diving experience

Trident’s powerful dual thrusters produce up to 26.5 lbs (12 kg) of thrust, propelling you through the water at a 4 mph (6.5 km/h). On their own, most swimmers can only reach around 3.7 mph (5.9 km/h), and can’t top speeds for long. Break the boundaries of human limitation and conquer the ocean with Trident!

Most recreational divers are limited to a depth of 98 ft (30 m), but Trident can easily travel with more experienced and professional divers down to 164 ft (50 m). By reducing the time and energy it takes to reach your maximum depths, Trident helps you explore deeper ocean environments, expand your own diving prowess, and capture magical moments with increased ease and flexibility. 

Trident’s powerful, removable battery runs for 45 minutes after a full charge and takes only 1.5 hours to recharge. That’s even less time than it takes to charge your phone! Trident also comes with an automatic low battery alert, so you’ll know when it’s time to exchange a spent battery for a fully charged one.

Trident: The Terrific Underwater Scooter

No two people see the ocean the same way, and our two-speed modes allow for a wide range of underwater experiences. Those looking to race to new depths can zip along at 4 mph, while others hoping to take in the scenic ocean view can cruise by at a leisurely 2.2 mph. Users can toggle between the two modes with just the touch of a button, moving through the ocean as naturally as a dolphin.

We know kids are especially curious about the ocean, and we designed Trident to be easy to use for people of all ages. With supervision, children can enjoy swimming with Trident just as much as adults. But for parents’ peace of mind, we have included a child safety lock to prevent accidents and improper usage.

Trident’s integrated design looks great from every angle, perfect for your GoPro selfies and home videos. More importantly, its streamlined wings decrease water resistance, so you can fly through the water quickly, smoothly, and comfortably.

While Trident is running, its natural positive buoyancy is canceled out by its powerful motor, making it effectively neutral. You’ll never have to worry about losing it in the ocean! But when it runs out of power, you can conveniently let Trident float to the surface to exchange the battery.

What you do and where you go with Trident is limited only by your imagination, so we designed it to be compatible with GoPro and other diving devices. Capture your incredible underwater journey on film, or add a flashlight to illuminate caves or darker depths.

Genienno Trident Underwater Scooter - Full Review

Don't forget to subscribe to Dustin Dunnill Youtube channel if you like this video
 

Problems pointed out to us include:

Problem1: Poor packaging

Solution: In our final product, the packaging will be improved and optimized, will have better foaming to hold Trident securely in place, and not only that, the final product will come with a lot of supporting accessories. 

Problem2: Silicone Padding on Trident comes off easily

Solution: In the final product, we will adopt industrial strength glue which will make it very hard for the padding to come off
 

Problem3: Battery time and cable

Solution: 45 minutes for continuous low speed and 25 mins for continuous fast speed. The battery cable will be made thinner so that it fits better hence making it easier to put and remove the battery cover 
 

Problem4: Delayed turnoff

Solution: The problem is due to the spring in the switch because of which the longer you press the button, the longer the spring takes to go back to its original position. In our new model, we will use an improved spring technology which will recoil as soon as the user lets go of the button making Trident halt immediately.

Thanks so much for you for your support,  please contact Turner at lgh@geneinno.com for all issue.

Problems pointed out to us include:
Problem1: Poor packaging
Solution: In our final product, the packaging will be improved and optimized, will have better foaming to hold Trident securely in place, and not only that, the final product will come with a lot of supporting accessories. 
Problem2: Silicone Padding on Trident comes off easily
Solution: In the final product, we will adopt industrial strength glue which will make it very hard for the padding to come off
 
Problem3: Battery time and cable
Solution: 45 minutes for continuous low speed and 25 mins for continuous fast speed. The battery cable will be made thinner so that it fits better hence making it easier to put and remove the battery cover 
 
Problem4: Delayed turnoff
Solution: The problem is due to the spring in the switch because of which the longer you press the button, the longer the spring takes to go back to its original position. In our new model, we will use an improved spring technology which will recoil as soon as the user lets go of the button making Trident halt immediately.














Thanks so much for you for your support,  please contact Turner at lgh@geneinno.com for all issue.

story:
It has been well-documented that much of the disease, malnutrition and famine in the third world is related to the lack of clean, potable water. 

Despite the efforts of multi-national NGOs and millions of dollars of relief money, this problem still exists. The challenges seem insurmountable. Wells with traditional hand pumps are only effective to a depth of 150 feet. On top of this, most of the hand pump work is performed by children whose limited strength cannot pump beyond 100 feet. 

What if there was a solution to all of these complex issues? 

What if there was a technology that would allow a child to pump to depths 2-10 times that of traditional methods? What if the pump was made of plastic, a material with no salvage value to a thief? Think of how a simple solution could provide easier access to clean water to more than a billion people.

Hydro Hand Pumps has the technology. 

What we don't have is the $50,000 to build our prototypes and start getting these pumps in the hands of the hundreds of water charities that already exist. Our objective is to produce a hand pump capable of pumping to depths greater than 500 feet. This is a conservative figure, as we are in the process of proving achievable levels of 1,000 feet or more. 

Lake Washington Institute of Technology in Kirkland, WA, is donating their time and expertise to complete the initial design of the plastic hand pump. They will be working with the engineers from Hydro Pacific Pumps to ensure that the design fits with the existing technology. After this basic design is completed, the molds can be built - where the molds get built will depend on whether we can build the molds using 3D printing or they need to be machined.  

“A hand pump that can pump water at a rate of 2-5 gpm at a depth of 500 feet would change the dynamics of water well drilling/pumping throughout Africa, and it would handle probably 75% of the well depths in Africa. 1,000 feet would handle basically 100% of the water wells in Africa.” – Ted Kuepper, REM, Executive Director of Global Water

Our brass prototype is shown below:

 

Risks and challenges:

We have already made numerous contacts and connections with humanitarian organizations, but need to continue to gain awareness throughout the non-profit and charitable organization community. We will continue to educate organizations about our technology and leverage our experience and contacts to do so.

Once we secure these relationships and build our plastic prototypes, the next step will be field work and testing. Our main focus will be troubleshooting any repair issues - these pumps must be easily repairable by the people in their area. We will work with locals to ensure they are educated on how to address any issues and carry out any necessary repairs.

We believe we are equipped to handle objections and challenges with the extensive engineering and 40 years of proven research we have behind our technology.

We need your help!

We do need funding to launch this technology, and we have some pretty cool merchandise to send you for your donations, but we understand that not everyone can make a donation. Please help us out by sharing this project with everyone that you can - whether it's through email, Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Pinterest, Instagram or shouting from mountaintops. Thank you!

story:
Hi, my name is Makena Morley and I am a junior at Bigfork High School in Montana. I absolutely love to run, distance running to be exact, it is the most amazing thing in the world, it makes you feel good and it is so fun! I am fundraising money to help pay for my airfare and my hotel expenses to allow me to compete at the New Balance Track and Field Outdoor Nationals, my dad will be coming with me because I am not the best traveler by myself, so I would definitely get lost without him! I will be racing the 5000 meter there (which is a distance race, the same length as a local 5k would be) and I am also doing either the 1 mile or the 2 mile, I have not decided on which one of those two I will do yet! As a junior I have been to 4 national championship races (three for cross country and one for indoor track) but I have never won a national title, so this one is very important to me because I would love for this to be the year for me to win; it is an important year for my college recruiting process, because this is the year when all the colleges are looking at you and at what you have accomplished! Also, these races will give me the chance to race all the best girl distance runners in the nation, which is so fun and it will allow me to run to my best potential! This year has been really good for me so far in the track season;  I am having a lot of fun and things are really coming along! We are in the post season now and state is coming soon, it will be on May 30 and 31! I am so excited for nationals this June because I feel I really have a chance this time around to win a national title! Helping me get to Nationals would be so amazing because it would give me a chance to achieve my goal I have had all my high school career, that is winning a national title.  I have looked at how much the airline tickets cost to go to Greensboro, North Carolina on June 13-15, which is where the national meet is, and I was quite amazed at how expensive they are! I am trying to raise 2300 dollars, which will pay for my  airplane tickets, hotel costs and rental car costs! If I do not reach my fundraising goal, I will use any money I have raised to offset our travel expenses.   If I exceed my fundraising goal I will put the excess in an account that my family and I will use for upcoming race expenses. I am so excited for this journey! I am feeling really ready, I have been training for this specific event since last December and the training has been awesome! I cannot wait to see what I can do against the best girls in the nation!  Here is a link to the New Balance Outdoor Track and Field Nationals official site so you can see what the schedule of events are and past results, and read more about the whole event, and even watch my race live: http://www.nationalscholastic.org/nbon

My goals again for this event are to hopefully win a national title in the 5000, and getting a personal best in either the 1 mile or the 2 mile!

 If you can't contribute money please spread the word to your friends or anyone who can help! To anyone who contributes, I will send a picture of me in my race and I will sign it, with a little note! I am super excited and cannot wait for June to come! Thank you!

story:
As busy professionals, we often find ourselves with too many items to conveniently carry, especially during business trips of 2 or 3 days when a suitcase is too much and a simple day pack isn’t enough. On top of that, typical backpacks don’t seem to accommodate the essential items we need like chargers, tablets, and laptops.

That’s why we designed OnePack, a super functional backpack for daily essentials, clothing, and mobile devices - the perfect companion for overnights and trips of up to 3 days.

OnePack is a backpack built for modern life. It’s compact, lightweight and designed with specialized compartments for school, business or travel. Its contemporary styling is cool as well as functional, with integrated USB and headphone ports to connect and protect your essential mobile devices. The OnePack is made for active, connected lifestyles and is the perfect all-in-one backpack for daily use.

 

 

Check the unbiased review of OnePack from ashens, an amazing channel featuring comedy videos and gadget reviews, thanks so much for his awesome work！

 
 
 

 

In the lower space, there are pockets to hold your laptop and tablet securely and safely. It’s snug and padded and adds protection in case of bumps and drops.

 

 

The upper space can be opened up 180 degrees, making it easy to organize clothing and other essentials that need easy access.

 

 

Unlike typical backpacks, all your items won’t get lost or disorganized by throwing them into a single compartment. OnePack has 19 specialized compartments to perfectly store everything you need with fast, easy access whenever you need them.

Safety was a very important consideration when we designed OnePack. The secure strap lock gives you convenient security and peace of mind when you are in public places such as cafes or airports.

story:
Are you an Adventuress woman?

Adventuress is the ultimate guidebook for any woman travelling. From safety tips to restaurant recommendations to clothing guides, we’re here to help you navigate it. The site has dedicated sections for women of colour, queer women, trans women, disabled women, and older women, so you know the advice you’re receiving is always tailored for you.

Adventuress is the brainchild of Lauren Ingram, a journalist, editor and travel junkie who has visited more than 25 countries in only 7 years. 

As a queer woman who has often travelled alone, Lauren knows the importance of feeling safe and knowing the lay of the land in a new city, area or country. And while women make 80% of all travel decisions each year, most traditional travel guides are written by men and don't consider the specific needs of women. 

Adventuress will provide travel content and digital travel guides from a foundation of intersectional feminism. Covering everything from safety, to where to buy women's health products, to accomodation recommendations and budget guides. 

Lauren (pictured) studied journalism and political communication and has worked in both magazines, online media and communications.

Where is the money going?

Every single cent of the money raised is going to paying female writers all over world to write content and contribute to guides for the site. With an exciting line up of diverse women writing stories on topics like the top queer bars in Italy to what it's like travelling as a woman of colour through Europe to how to stay safe when travelling alone.

Perks

In addition to supporting the project, you can choose from a range of perks depending on your level of contribution. 

  • Digital travel guides: One of the core features of Adventuress is digital travel guides to help women plan their trip to different cities, areas and countries, as well as specific guides giving tips for travelling as a woman of colour, queer woman, trans woman, disabled woman or older woman.
  • Temporary tattoos: Wear your support on your sleeve with temporary tattoos featuring the slick compass logo of Adventuress
  • Tote bag: A stylish and durable canvas tote bag bearing the Adventuress compass logo printed on the side
  • Luggage tag: Ensure you never lose your suitcase or backpack with a vegan leather luggage tag featuring the Adventuress logo embossed on the outside
  • Travel journal: The limited edition Adventuress travel journal is perfect for writing down your travel memories or even jotting down notes while planning your next adventure
  • Overnight bag: A Country Road-style cotton bag that is perfect as a carry on, or for a night away in a hotel, featuring the Adventuress logo printed on one side
  • Invite to launch party: In addition to the above, become a founding supporter to get an invite for you and a plus one to the Adventuress launch party in Sydney (accommodation and travel not included).

Other Ways You Can Help

We'd love for you to contribute, but if you can't please share the campaign on social media, and of course sign up to the mailing list at AdventuressMag.com

story:
SUNY Purchase has one of the few classical fencing clubs in existence. In the club students learn French & Italian foil, French & Italian epee, Northern & Southern Italian dueling sabre, French smallsword, Italian & Spanish rapier, longsword and the German dusack among other styles.

Every year, the Association for Historical Fencing and Palm Beach Classical Fencing holds an open tournament in the West Palm Beach area.Every year, the SUNY Purchase Fencing Club tries to send as many members as we can, with several fencers interested this year. Your contributions will help to cover travel expenses, which we desperately need!

If you cannot contribute any funds, please forward this to friends and family to help get the word out!

story:
photo.timeline: Timeline your story.

photo.timeline offers you completely new perspective on the world and enables you to see things through the eyes of others. Discover interesting places, follow something you love, share images that move you and inspire people all around the globe.

Take a look, there is a live demo example on http://www.phototimeline.com

What is photo.timeline?

photo.timeline is a platform which enables you to create amazing photo timelines in an easy and fun way by organizing tiles. Timelines are organized in streams by tag, location or users, so you can easily find things that you are interested in and follow them.

photo.timeline is a perfect place for photographers, journalists, media companies and photography lovers. It's very easy to express yourself through your own stream of photo.timelines by telling amazing stories to the world.

We want to store full resolution, maximum quality images, so that we can provide you with the best experience, no matter what device you are using

Mobile applications

Mobile app gives you the ability to create your timelines on the go. The app will help you organize your timelines using locations, your nearby friends and other available information. All you need to do once you start a timeline is approve a photo for upload. You can also browse through other timelines, or follow your friends, favorite streams, photographers, etc. We are planinig on supporting Android, iOS, and are considering the possibilty of adding Google Glass to this list.

Why are we here?

  • We think that we have an innovative approach to photo presentation and that indiegogo is a good way to get a feedback on our idea, so we want to spread the word about the photo.timeline
  • Hosting photos in full quality can be expensive and we want to provide the best experience so we are here to get hosting resources for photo.timeline
  • There are still some features to implement so we need to fund the development (at the moment we have less than 20% to finish)
  • The best camera is the one you have with you, and in most cases that is your smartphone, which enables you to easily create and share your timelines on the go. We need to fund the development of mobile applications

Our plan

Terminology

photo.timeline - your own story, a timeline of photos, this is a public type of photo.timeline, anyone can view, share and discuss about it. You can see an example at our demo site.

private photo.timeline - when you want to share with your friends and family only, this timeline cannot be found through our search engine or by browsing through categories, it is associated with a special link and it is visible only to the people who have that link

stream - A stream contains a multiple photo.timelines with something common like location, tag or creator. Streams are the result of the things you are looking for, and from the stream you can travel and explore specific timelines

custom stream - A special promoted type of stream with associated url path (http://phototimeline.com/your_stream_name) which can be customized by user (creator of the stream) - for media companies, photographers, journalists, etc and when you need more attention to your work.

premium resources amount in $ - for when you need more, we will provide a system where you obtain credits. You can use those credits to buy more resources above the limits of basic account like streams, photo.timelines, private timelines, increase a number of images per phototimeline, etc. Some of the perks contain extra credits!

Take a look, there is a live demo example on http://www.phototimeline.com

Thank you for supporting us!

story:
Hi, my names North Nickel, a senior in High School and a cofounder of Nomad Plug. I’m part of an active family of 4 who is constantly outdoors: hiking, rock-climbing or hanging by the pool. Like most families we are constantly updating Facebook, listening to music, taking pictures or finding directions via some electronic device. Being heavy power consumers we frequently run out of battery power. 

Two years ago I started searching for a portable solar device that could give us our power fix and was amazed at how incompatible, expensive and unfashionable the portable retail space was. I teamed up with my father to build a device that would solve these problems and I’m trying to get “thenomad” to market. 

Incompatibility: Most computers produce 0.5 Amps and 2.5 Watts of constant power via their USB 2.0 port. If you have a power source that falls below that threshold the battery stops charging. Most portable solar panels are rated for 5 watts or less. If the sun is impeded by clouds the solar cell can easily dip below the requirements needed to charge. 

Some electronics have a voltage sensor such as the iphone5 which shut down the power port if the volts fluctuate out of a designated range. Since power fluctuation is dependent on sun intensity these devices can become useless with small cloud movement. 

With “theNomad” we utilized panels rated for 7 watts allowing the necessary wiggle room for less than perfect conditions. We are also introducing theNomad with a rechargeable lithium battery pack allowing theNomad to charge the battery, while simultaneously allowing the battery to provide consistent power to any USB device. 

Price: 7w portable solar panels with a battery pack are priced well over $120. We are planning on retailing our solar panel with a lithium battery pack for $85. For those only interested in the solar panel we will be retailing the device for $75.

Design: I believe we’ve created the best looking design on the market. The solar cell is small, water resistant, with a pocket to hold a batter pack. Every other solar cell on the market is currently black or camouflage and the battery pack is usually a second thought to the overall design.


Nerd talk 

What are Watts? The Watt is the basic unit of power. It is named after the eighteenth-century Scottish inventor James Watt. Power = Voltage x Current, so Watts = Volts x Amps.

What are Volts? Volts is a unit of electromotive force, the volt measures how much “potential” there is in an electric circuit. The higher the voltage, the more electrical current will flow through the circuit.

What are Amps? Amperes (or Amps), is the measure of electric current. One Amp is equal to a number of electrons passing a point in a circuit each second at a certain voltage.

It all started with 2 simple solar cells and a circuit board. My first prototype was 2 X 2.5 watt cells hooked together in series to create 5 watts. I choose this configuration as the most demanding USB devices charged with 5 volts and 1 amp.

Picture of one of my first prototypes


This solar cell worked great for most devices but those demanding devices would only charge between 11:00 am and 4:00 pm on perfectly sunny days. In the morning or evening 4 watts of power was common which lowered the amp and volts below the desired threshold. Back to the drawing board.

I changed to a more powerful solar cell with 2 X 3.5 watts for a total of 7 watts. This worked perfect and is the same configuration I currently use. However, this change created a problem as more than 5 volts can damage some USB products.  I finally solved this problem by adding a voltage regulator. 

A voltage regulator generates a fixed output voltage that remains constant regardless of changes to its input voltage or load conditions. Basically the regulator compares the output voltage with a precise reference 5 voltage and adjusts the BJT pass device to maintain that constant output voltage.

I've made around 30 Nomad prototypes and I’m impressed with their capabilities.During testing cell phones and MP3 players charged within 1-3 hours. Smart phone, GPS, USB camera and lithium battery packs charge between 2-4 hours.

Quick video tutorial on the inner-workings of the Nomad 



Risks and challenges

TheNomad has been made, tested, and outperforms most solar cells on the market. We have been creating solar cells for several years and they have been my companion on many an outdoor adventure. The $5,000 I’m trying to raise will allow me to utilize a manufacture taking the heavy lifting out of my hands.

The largest risk I see is manufacturing theNomad in volume and having them shipped by Christmas. I've tested out the manufacture and have received samples in less than a week. I also have a contract with them guaranteeing production of 500 units every 2 weeks. This hasn't been tested and is a potential risk depending on the quantity sold.

I’m a senior in high school; however, my dad is a co-owner of the company. My father is a PMP which is a fancy acronym for a certified project manager. He has managed large multimillion dollar projects and I’m learning a lot from his tenure.

I'm setting a very realistic goal of $5,000. Once I have the funds I'll be able to get the items manufactured and in my hands by the end of November. It will be tight but I’m shooting to get your rewards to you a few weeks before Christmas.

It breaks down like this: Nov 1 is when Indiegogo ends. Then 14 days for Indiegogo to release the money to nomad. Then 14 days to get the gear made and shipped to me. Then another 1 or 2  to get it packed and shipped to everyone who pledged.

I'll be using Facebook, youtube, my website, and Indiegogo to keep everyone informed of the progress.

1st week Thank You Video
story_txt:
Hi, my names North Nickel, a senior in High School and a cofounder of Nomad Plug. I’m part of an active family of 4 who is constantly outdoors: hiking, rock-climbing or hanging by the pool. Like most families we are constantly updating Facebook, listening to music, taking pictures or finding directions via some electronic device. Being heavy power consumers we frequently run out of battery power. 
Two years ago I started searching for a portable solar device that could give us our power fix and was amazed at how incompatible, expensive and unfashionable the portable retail space was. I teamed up with my father to build a device that would solve these problems and I’m trying to get “thenomad” to market. 
Incompatibility: Most computers produce 0.5 Amps and 2.5 Watts of constant power via their USB 2.0 port. If you have a power source that falls below that threshold the battery stops charging. Most portable solar panels are rated for 5 watts or less. If the sun is impeded by clouds the solar cell can easily dip below the requirements needed to charge. 
Some electronics have a voltage sensor such as the iphone5 which shut down the power port if the volts fluctuate out of a designated range. Since power fluctuation is dependent on sun intensity these devices can become useless with small cloud movement. 
With “theNomad” we utilized panels rated for 7 watts allowing the necessary wiggle room for less than perfect conditions. We are also introducing theNomad with a rechargeable lithium battery pack allowing theNomad to charge the battery, while simultaneously allowing the battery to provide consistent power to any USB device. 
Price: 7w portable solar panels with a battery pack are priced well over $120. We are planning on retailing our solar panel with a lithium battery pack for $85. For those only interested in the solar panel we will be retailing the device for $75.
Design: I believe we’ve created the best looking design on the market. The solar cell is small, water resistant, with a pocket to hold a batter pack. Every other solar cell on the market is currently black or camouflage and the battery pack is usually a second thought to the overall design.




Nerd talk

1st week Thank You Video

story:
Building off of last year's "A Native Odyssey" campaign  (that reached over one million people!), The TU Costa 5 Rivers program is sending four students from colleges around the country to explore  Alaskan public lands. These Millennials will meet and fish with coalition of locals, conservation professionals, native Alaskans and community leaders to discover the challenges that face Alaskan public lands and native fish if current policy is adversely changed.

During this case study, these students will cross Alaska for five weeks to get a 360 degree perspective on the environmental, economic, and spiritual significance of the salmon runs have on the state, those who live there, and what will happen to the worlds wild salmon supply if irresponsible resource extraction becomes commonplace. Students upload content in real time via a blog, vlog, as well as create a short summary film about their experience. In an effort to raise awareness to the broader public about the value of these public land fisheries. Not to mention fish their brains out along the way! 

Through your contributions, we will be able to help Trout Unlimited purchase critical gear for the students trip. Such as camera rentals, SAT phones, travel related expenses, and social media promotion!  And did we mention the SWAG?! For all the help, we will send you some great swag from trip sponsors!

With our collation of Trout Unlimited, Costa Sunglasses, the US Forest Service, Simms Fishing Products, Orvis and Fishpond USA, we expect to reach over three million people through traditional, earned and social media campaign. 

Who are the student leaders you ask?! Here is short bio of each one:

Anthony Ortiz, University of Colorado-Boulder: (Link)

McCarthy Kessler, Metro State: (Link)

Libby Glaser, Missouri State: (Link)

Kylie Hogan, University of Pittsburgh-Johnstown: (Link)

If you unable to make a donation at this time, please share the campaign through Indiegogo share tools, as well as leaving a comment for the US Army Core of Engineers to protect Bristol Bay from Pebble Mine here! 

Thank you for all the help with securing the protection of public lands and getting the next generation outside!

 

Photos Curiosity of: Flyout Media, Trout Unlimited Alaska, and the 2017 Native Odyssey Crew

story:
Short Summary

My name is Bobby Mardis and I have been a filmmaker for the past 30 years developing all areas of content from an independent perspective for film and television.  I have worked on commercials with Maya Angelou, directed music projects with over two hundred musicians from Herbie Hancock to Freddie Hubbart, and narrative projects with Emmy Award winning actors like Glynn Turman. My passion is shooting content and making it come alive on film, then delivery to a broadcast exhibition.

My campaign is geared raise funding to pay for the balance of court costs as I fight for the rights for all creative people who live in apartments, do business out of their apartment creating and developing intellectual properties from music, to scripts, to film, to books, and anything that is considered an intellectual property. I am also fighting for the people who run all kinds of businesses out of their apartments. And lastly, I am fighting for anyone who has signed a rental lease agreement excusing the management of any negligence the management does.  All the monies raised will go towards fighting the legal battle. 

This project is important because in Los Angeles and most major metropolitan cities, there are individuals who stand the risk of having their valuables stolen and never replaced by the insurance companies, AND ALL BECAUSE OF FINE PRINT CLAUSE THAT THEY ARE HIDING IN THE AGREEMENT. It is happening to me and if they win, it will open the door for other people to be ripped off as well. We won at summary judgment, but the trial is another story and it takes financial resources to compete with the big boys. This is important to me and every artist, or person who creates from their apartment. Should your work be stolen due to negligence, no hidden verbiage should shield the responsibility from the Insurance Company and the Owners. It is simply white-collar crime if is goes unaddressed and without a fight.

Your contribution, how ever large or small that you might feel it might be, will help and resemble one brick solidifying a wall of supporters.  You can shield us from the corporate moneygrubbers that constantly take from the little guys to keep the one-percenters in business. Right is right and wrong is wrong.

What We Need & What You Get

The accumulative fund that we are raising is $8,000 and it will help pay for expert witnesses, jury fees, lawyer fees, evidence demonstrations, copying, messengers, court filings and all aspect of line items that deal with the legal portion of this case. In order to fight them, we have to do it in court under the eyes of the law so that the end result sets the mood for all cases like this hereafter. We need you to speak up and support financially.

 

Our goal is to pay for the ending stretch of this three-year legal battle.  All money raised will not only pay for the next wave of bills, but it will pay for the loans that were acquired within the first set of bills. We have to keep our eyes on the prize, which is justice for all artists working out of their apartments.

 

This project is unique in that it represents literally millions of people who either live in apartments and run businesses, or create intellectual property that has a lifespan that extends way beyond the life of the creator.  Your donation will help to preserve this freedom. Even though I am the plaintiff in this case, I am defending the right to work in the space that I pay a monthly rental and cherish the though of working without the fear of losing my hard work at the drop of a dime. That is all in jeopardy with this case. Your efforts will work for the good of maintaining the art of creative expression in the comfort of your apartment.  

The Impact

For those of you who need a little more information on the case, which is being tried in the Superior Court in Santa Monica, you can go on-line and conduct your own personal review. (Case No. SC116029).  This is one way to really contribute to society, stand up for justice, and voice your opinion about the out-of-control powers of corporations. Just like voting, your financial voice will make a difference in this case. You will walk away feeling the pride of doing something good for all people and particularly, people who use their space, creativity and imagination to create “something from nothing.” There is value in what we do!

I have creating many successful projects as evidenced by going to www.BobbyMardis.com and viewing some of my completed productions and video overviews.  The three films that were stolen were going to be three monumental projects that were geared to inspired, and evoke pride into the community. Most importantly, everyone has a right given by the first amendment to express themselves in mediums that connect to the general public with their audible, visual and written opinions.

Other Ways You Can Help

Another way to really help push this message and to help all creative people is to not only leave a donation before you leave this site, but copy the link and send it to at least fifty of your friends who share your same convictions.

Please cost this link on your facebook, myspace, linkedin, instagram and twitter pages.  If you would post this link on every Monday for the next six weeks, it would be really helpful in spreading the word.

You can go to your personal email account and send a personal message along this the link to twenty of your favorite people.

Lastly, you can verbally spread the word by asking people to indieGoGo and typing “RobbingTheCreativeCommunity” Or “HELP FIGHT CORPORATE INJUSTICE LEGALLY”

Thank You!!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chad Butler. I am photographer and videographer based out of San Diego. On July 5, 2016 I will embark on a photography journey through Iceland, Italy, Switzerland and finally Germany. The focus of the trip is to capture as many of the beautiful landscapes of these countries through still photography and time lapse photography. This is not a paid project, but a personal project that is very important to me. To complete my project goal, I will need some support. I am offering a pre-sale of various size prints of photographs I take on my trip. 

What I Need & What You Get

At the end of my trip, I will post an online photo gallery of all the images that were taken. Supporters will be able to browse the photos and select their favorite images for the size prints they purchased. 

  • Target goal is $2000
  • Prints will be offered on standard photo paper, metal, canvas or just about any medium you can think of. 
  • If the $2000 dollar goal is not met, any supporter will still receive the print they ordered.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word and share this campaign. 
  • Follow my adventure on Instagram at http://www.instagram.com/twoten_productions and Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/chadmichaelbutler

story:
Technology saves rare artifacts        in the Himalayas: Bhutan


It is time for action! We need your help in protecting rare artifacts in Bhutan – with the innovative use of digital technology!

Antique hunters destroy precious Bhutanese heritage for money. In this time of dramatic and alarming rise in the theft of art treasures from Himalayan Buddhist Monasteries, our project teaches use of the smartphone as a vital documentation tool to prove ownership. Art theft worldwide is a major criminal enterprise.


Fire, flood, earthquake and political upheaval destroy traditional treasures. Our vision is the documentation of cultural heritage treasures worldwide, through the training and empowerment of local treasure caretakers using low-cost, universally available technology (mobiles and tablets) and their existing skills (texting, email, video, and photography). Very few have access to highly complicated cataloging technology used by museums that require expensive computers.


Your donation:

• Trains cultural caretakers in digital documentation and preservation of monastery and town treasures

• Trains caretakers to create confidential digital inventories that include video/audio files

• Trains caretakers how to conduct interviews with elders, how to video the interviews, and how to integrate the oral histories with the digital inventory records

• Provides for follow-up visits to the participants’ monastery to work one-on-one on digital documentation and to advise on specific preservation concerns regarding cultural heritage 

• Supports continuing training, via email, social media and phone 

• Creates technical updates as mobile and Cloud technology advances 

• Provides access to a worldwide network of preservation professionals 



Awards and Previous Session of the Workshop 

The project has been nominated for the prestigious international Manthan award for innovative use of digital technology for cultural heritage preservation, and the ENorth award, for the successful implementation of our session held at Namgyal Institute in Gangtok (India) in the spring of 2014. 

We have won!! Special Mention for innovative use of digital technology at the ENorthEast awards held in Mizoram, India! Treasure Caretaker Training is a Finalist in the prestigious Manthan Awards, Digital Empowerment Foundation held on December 4 in Delhi!  One of our monk participants will be there showing visitors how he documents sacred art with his smartphone! Our Project Director will be presenting the project to the large assembly of technical experts, and our Project Manager will be sharing details of the upcoming project in Bhutan!


The Impact of the Project 

The previous session of the project had a huge impact in art conservation in the Himalayas. This session will impact even more participants, institutions and countries. 


Why we need your help 

In order to implement this session in Bhutan, we need to raise a total of $40,000, and foundation and corporate funding is in process. 

Your contribution to Indiegogo will cover the costs involved in educating the Bhutan Treasure Caretaker community: monks, nuns, and lay cultural caretakers from local villages who will travel to the conference site. 

We offer attractive traditional gifts from Bhutan that will make your contribution memorable and more than worthwhile! Have a look at the perks!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t give a donation, you are very important to us.

Spread the word on social media, and help us connect to more people. Join the spirit of the campaign and help the Treasure Caretakers to keep their cultures alive and well documented – through this innovative use of technology.

story: Going into Southwest Regionals the prospects didn't look good. My teams record was 1-11 in official matches, we never practice together, and we haven't had the same roster for a single tournament. Despite all these odds after 7 hard fought matches we ended the weekend with a record of 4-3, we even beat a team ranked nearly 100 spots ahead of us within the USQ, and we snagged the last ticket to World Cup this April. This year World Cup is being held in Rock Hill, South Carolina. And I need help paying for the plane ticket and rides too and from the airport, the hotel, and the fields. Any contribution would be greatly appreciated.

This year World Cup is being held in Rock Hill, South Carolina. And I need help paying for the plane ticket and rides too and from the airport, the hotel, and the fields. Any contribution would be greatly appreciated.

story:
The New York Shock Exchange is sending a roller derby team to South America and we need your help! We'll be touring Argentina to help South American men's leagues complete their requirements to join the Men's Roller Derby Association [MRDA]. Each league needs to play a game against a current member before they can join the MRDA.

In 2012, the Shock Exchange went to England to help the first two European men’s derby leagues accomplish their goal of joining. Because of NYSE's UK tour, 15% of the MRDA member leagues are now located in Europe.  Then, In 2015, the Shock Exchange went to Australia.  Two leagues, Sydney City SMASH and the Brisbane Scartel, are now part of MRDA and we expect more to join soon. Now it is time for South America!

Photo courtesy of Hispanic Attack

Founded in 2007, the New York Shock Exchange is one of the first modern men's roller derby leagues to be established and a founding member of the Men’s Roller Derby Association. Always at or near the top of the MRDA rankings, we have a lot to offer to newly established and expanding leagues: exposure, instruction, and competition. A positive, grassroots, skater-owned-and-operated sport; modern roller derby in the past decade has inspired the establishment of some 800 leagues in the United States and 1,500 leagues worldwide.  It is part of the New York Shock Exchange's mission to contribute to the growth of the sport and community of roller derby by whatever means possible.

The Shock Exchange will play in the H.A.R.D (Hombres Americanos Roller Derby) tournament and scrimmage Team Argentina as well as run bootcamps in Buenos Aires and Cordoba. Teams we will be playing include the Buenos Aires Conspiracy and the Thunderquads, both of Buenos Aires, Contragolpe of Mendoza, and Terror S-Quad of Santiago de Chile, and in the last stop of our tour, we will take on the best of Argentina by competing against Team Argentina.  More info about the trip, the boot camps, and live streaming of the bouts is available at our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/nyshockexchange) and www.nyshockexchange.com.

What We Need & What You Get

This will be an incredible experience for everyone involved, but it doesn’t come cheap. To send a single skater to Argentina, it costs nearly $1,500, which covers airfare, food, lodging, and transportation.

Our goal for this campaign is to gather enough money to send just one of our skaters to South America. We will be supplementing your generous contributions with sponsorship, fundraising, and most particularly with money from our own pockets.

To thank our backers for your generous contributions, we have some great rewards at many different levels.

Tour Details

We will compete in Torneo H.A.R.D. on February 7th and 8th, facing off against the Buenos Aires Conspiracy, the Thunderquads, Contragolpe, and the Terror S-Quad.  On February 9th, we will be holding a boot camp for all attendees of Torneo H.A.R.D. before hitting the streets of Buenos Aires to celebrate Carnaval!  After enjoying the celebrations of Argentina's capital city, we will travel to Córdoba to take in more historical sights.  There, we will also face off against Team Argentina before holding one final boot camp in the country.

Photo courtesy of Roaringstorm Photography

Thank you for your support!

Every dollar you contribute makes a difference. We are committed to this trip. We intend for our efforts to strengthen and expand the global roller derby community.  Help us by sharing in that effort.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help get us to Argentina. Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Promote our campaign and our tour through email and social media! 

Help the Shock Exchange spread the MRDA to Sudamérica! Please pledge your support to help grow our sport across the world!

story:
Charity for the Danish Powerchair Football Team.

Why this campaign?
My wife is personal helper for a man with duchenne muscular dystrophy. He have over the years become a good friend to me.  I have seen some great athletes with different disabilities representing Denmark in Championships. I have seen the latest matches online and it came clear to me, that the team need some better equipment to compete on an even level with the other teams in Europe and the rest of the world.
The Danish Powerchair Football Team have just qualified for the World Championship next year. This happened at the European Championship in Limerick Ireland. Therefor we are setting this campaign up. We want to support the team, by giving the team new chairs.

What We Need & Why We Need It

On a Powerchair Football Team there are 8 players. They have their normal chairs, for daily use. In the championships the teams that doing best, is the teams with the bests gear. So next step, is this:

  • Each chair costs 10.000 € in a basic configuration. There are some of the players that have special needs for their chair, so the price for each chair will be about 12.000 €.
  • We also need funding for support tools for the chairs.
  • All in all, we have a goal of 100.000€.
  • If, we don't achieve the goal, we'll see what we can get.
    There is no money back garantie in this campaign.

Hope for the future

We hope that this campaign can provide funds for
"The new and improved Danish Powerchair Football National Team".

We hope that this campaign can help to develop a better community around the team and develop the Danish National NeedCare League.

Other Ways You Can Help

Its not all people that can give money to this campaign. We know that. But, you can all share this to your friends. Maybe there is a secret millionaire that think this is a great idea.

story:
Présentation

Le sport a toujours fait partie de ma vie, dont le basketball qui a pris une grande place. J'y ai joué pendant de nombreuses année et j'ai performé au niveau collégial AAA. J'ai aussi fait du flagfootball et de l'athlétisme avant de découvrir l'ultimate. Je participe aux compétitions nationales depuis 2007. J'ai remporté les grands honneurs à une seule reprise, participé à 5 finales et remporté une médaille de bronze au niveau canadien. J'ai aussi participé à de nombreux tournois américains (Boston, Sarasota, Las Vegas, Ohio, Columbus, New York, Philadelphie). J'ai eu l'argent aux championnat du monde par club en 2010 à Prague avec une équipe du Québec (Onyx) et l'or avec l'équipe nationale mixte en 2012, au Japon. Étant une athlete d'ultimate depuis maintenant 10 ans, je m'implique aussi dans le développement de la relève, depuis 4 ans, en entraînant les équipes juniors du Québec.

 Les fonds seront utilisés pour :

Pour pouvoir être une athlète internationale à l'ultimate, je dois financer personnellement chacune de mes saisons. Cette année, j'aurai deux camps d'entraînement (Vancouver et Montréal), un tournoi préparatoire à Seattle et les championnats du monde qui seront à Londres. Pour tous ces événements, je devrai couvrir les frais de transport (3 billets d'avions), les frais d'hébergement, ma nourriture, les frais d'inscriptions et les frais de membre. D'autres frais d'équipe s'ajoutent, comme salaire de l'entraîneur et mon uniforme. Finalement, afin d'être en parfaite santé lors des championnats, un montant pour la préparation physique et mentale est attribué, ainsi que la thérapie sportive.

 L'impact de votre contribution

Cet été, j'irai à Londres représenter mon pays pour une deuxième fois et je tenterai donc d'obtenir ma deuxième médaille d'or. Ceci est mon objectif et l'accomplissement de tous mes efforts. Avoir la chance de jouer avec les meilleures joueuses du pays et d'affronter l'excellence mondiale est l'occasion parfaite de m'accomplir en tant qu'athlète et de réaliser mon rêve qui est de faire partie de la meilleure équipe au monde.

Un des défis est le financement. Je suis étudiante à temps plein en thérapie du sport à l'université de Concordia. Vous comprendrez que le temps à mettre dans le travail est limité, avec les cours et les entraînements. C'est pourquoi j'utilise cette plateforme et aimerais avoir votre soutient! Que ce soit en faisait un don ou en partageant ma campagne. 

Aidez-moi à réaliser mon rêve de gagner une deuxième médaille d'or et à faire découvrir ma passion. L'ultimate est un des sports les plus complet, divertissant et accessible qui soit.

story:
I am the founder of Travel Easy Asia, we make mini bilingual travel guides. 

Why us? Well we're not your average travel guide,

Travel Easy Asia's T.E.A. City Cards are:
1. small and compact - 50 business sized cards connected by an openable ring. No more carrying around a heavy guide book! 
2. durable - 320g laminated card stock. So go ahead and spill that coffee!
3. concise - split into 4 sections: SEE SAY GO & WALK; they give you the best sights and recommendations to eat drink and be merry; No more wasting time sifting through lots of information and trying to choose what to do!
and BEST OF ALL..... 
4. bi-lingual! Every SEE & SAY card has the Thai script on the back so if you want to go somewhere, just SHOW & GO! No more struggling to communicate!

I've created this campaign because now we would like to test our product with technology and create a simple app so that we can save the trees and make travelling that much more convenient!  

If you can help us fund $3600 we will build an interactive app that will allow you to handle/zoom/ turn the cards, click on text for Thai audio, have offline maps for each location and more!  

What We Need

We need $3600 as the app creator we will go with is charging 1000USD for the basic app plus 1000 for offline map features plus 700 per additional city (1) and 200 per additional translation (3) and then we've alloted 300usd for Indiegogo's fees.

story:
The SufferJets, the Ithaca League of Women Rollers WFTDA charter team, needs your help to get to Franky Panky in Tampa!

The SufferJets have been playing roller derby since 2008 when the Ithaca League of Women Rollers was founded. After serving in the WFTDA apprentice program, the ILWR was accepted as a full member in 2011, and is currently ranked 100 out of 177 member leagues.

Still flying high from the exciting competition at the East Coast Derby Extravangaza in Philly we are ecstatic to head to Florida to compete in Franky Panky, a two day tournament hosted by Tampa Roller Derby. We will be taking on the hosts themselves, Tampa Roller Derby; the Tallahassee Rollergirls, and the Queen City Rollers.

Your contribution will not only help us fund our travel to Floriday but also keep us healthy and in good spirits all weekend!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're bringing 14 skaters and two bench coaches, that's $2,800 in airfare alone!
  • Four hotel rooms for 16 ladies for the weekend adds an additional $1,000.
  • The $1,200 extra that we're asking for will provide healthy meal options to keep the team fueled and strong for the weekend.
  • Ever wanted to join the ILWR family? This is a great opportunity to do so! Even if we don't meet our full goal, every little bit helps the SufferJets travel to Florida and represent the fine city of Ithaca.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean there isn't something you can do. Help us get the word out by promoting our campaign on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter, Instagram or any other social media.

Thanks for your help and we look forward to wearing out fancy pants at Franky Panky!

story:
Welcome!  You've found Phase Two of our IndieGoGo campaign 'From Silence To Justice'.  We want to thank all of the GENEROUS supporters who got us 69% ($3,425) of the way to our goal of $5,000.  You guys rock!

As the campaign closed on August 30th, we were wondering how we were going to fund the difference.  As you will see below, the money is going toward airfare, a month's lodging, food, and project-associated expenses for MIke's volunteer effort to go to India to help a local non-profit.  Essentially, the money we've raised to date will get him there, provide modest lodging and provide some meal money.  So now we just need to feed him the rest of the trip, cover miscellaneous expenses and bring him home!!

Here's where two Angels showed up.  Our friends Monica Kile and Steve Stauch are getting married in September and suggested we do a Phase Two so they can ask friends to donate to this project in lieu of a wedding gift.  How great is that?!?

So, if you've landed on this page and are a friend of Monica and Steve's, you're in the right place.  If you've happened upon us in Phase Two and are interested in this extremely important Human Rights project to tell the stories of the survivors of sexual violence and how CSJ's advocacy is making a difference, welcome, and we hope you will support us.

Here's more about the project:

About Michael Matlach

Mike is a humanitarian photographer who has spent his career exploring the world and bringing back images of its people.  His ability to interact comfortably in situations where compassion and patience is required is one of his strengths.  Some of his portfolio can be found at www.michaelmatlach.com

India holds a special place in Michael’s heart, having travelled both north and south during his dozen visits, so when he heard about Counsel to Secure Justice and it’s mission, he was compelled to act.  After spending the day with CSJ consultant, Jonathan Derby, he volunteered to give his time to document through photography and video, the challenges and victories of being an advocate for the survivors of sexual violence.

What He Needs & What You Get

Here’s where you come in – as is often the case, where volunteerism and reality collide, Mike is willing to spend the month of October in India helping document their mission, providing image and video content for their website, collateral material and possible documentary content to be used to raise awareness of their cause, but he needs your help in funding the trip.  Expenses for the airfare, lodging, food and equipment total $5,000. 

As a thank you for your generous donation, Mike is offering the following:

Ø At the $25 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes where he serves as Art Director, so you can send e-cards to celebrate life!  With over 500 global images to choose from (many of them from India), you’ll be sure to find just the right photo, quote and music to express yourself.  More info at: www.harmonywishes.com

Ø At the $50 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and a scarf from India which Mike will select for you while there and send with a special thank you when he returns.

Ø At the $100 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and his fine art print “Washing in the Ganges”, a 6” x 9” image on 8.5” x 11” archival paper. Location: Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, India (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)

Ø At the $250 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and two fine art prints “Faded Love: Man” and Faded Love: Woman”, 6” x 9” images on 8.5” x 11” archival paper.  Location: Dungapur, Rajasthan,India  (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)

Ø At the $500 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and his most popular image, “A View of the World”, 21” x 33” on 24” x 36” archival paper. Location: Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India  (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)

Ø At the $1,000, THE WHOLE ENCHILADA!  HarmonyWishes 20 card pack, ALL prints from each donation level and a huge THANK YOU! 

All gifts are from the heart.  Namaste.

Note: Donations above the $1,575 Phase Two goal will be given to CSJ to support their mission, so don't stop giving!!

The Impact

About CSJ: CSJ is a young organization that provides survivors of sexual violence free legal and psychosocial support throughout criminal proceedings, from when they report the abuse to police till judgment.  CSJ’s current project focuses on survivors of child sexual abuse in Delhi. CSJ advocates work on the ground—at the police station, hospitals and courts—advising government authorities on the law, supporting clients and monitoring the progress of cases.  They work with trustworthy partners to ensure clients and their families receive the care and support they need to begin healing from the trauma they have suffered. 

For a short video on CSJ, please check out the video in our Gallery tab.  Their website can be found at www.csjindia.org

The Facts and Why you should help

The need for legal support to victims of child sexual abuse is huge

· Child sexual abuse is a serious problem in India.  53.2% of children had experienced sexual abuse; 20.9% of children had suffered severe forms of sexual abuse, including rape. These percentages are staggering when you consider India has 1.2 billion people.

· More women and girls are coming forward to report sexual abuse in Delhi. Likely because media attention has increased after the gang rape and murder of a 23-year old physiotherapy student in December 2012, there were 1,636 rape cases registered with police in 2013, an increase of 132% from 2012 when 706 rape cases were reported.

· Low conviction rates and delayed justice. In 2013, only 27.1% of rape cases in India ended in conviction.  A 2012 CSJ internal study revealed a 20.5% conviction rate in Delhi and criminal proceedings took an average of 28.7 months to complete. 

Victims and their families need advocates to support and fight for them during criminal proceedings, so justice and healing are possible.

You’ve read the statistics.  Now here is a snapshot of CSJ’s cases:

Our clients’ average age is 10 ½ years old. We represent ten clients who are six years old and younger.  Two clients are one year old.  We have four gang-rape cases, nine incest cases, one client who has a mental disability, one client who is blind and one who is deaf and mute.  While their stories are disturbing, their vulnerability demonstrates the critical need for CSJ’s legal and psychosocial services.

Your money will help us share their stories and give them support

“Your presence gave me strength,” Rekha (name changed to protect identity) told CSJ lawyer Eliza Rumthao after she effectively testified against her abuser.  In a basic sense, Rekha’s words illustrate what CSJ does: we support our clients in times of their greatest darkness.  

Risks & Challenges

The challenge of the cultural sensitivities surrounding the topic of sexual violence in India is foremost in everyone's mind.  It's a topic that can be deeply shocking and can illicit deep grief and anger.  The combination of CSJ's experience in advocacy and Mike's genuine compassion will be a formidable force for good!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if your heart is bigger than your wallet, so if you can’t donate, we’d appreciate you sending out this message to your circle of friends via email, social media or word of mouth. 

“ Never doubt that a small group of committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.” ~ Margaret Mead


Blessings,

Mike and the CSJ team
