some meal money.  So now we just need to feed him the rest of the trip, cover miscellaneous expenses and bring him home!!Here's where two Angels showed up.  Our friends Monica Kile and Steve Stauch are getting married in September and suggested we do a Phase Two so they can ask friends to donate to this project in lieu of a wedding gift.  How great is that?!?So, if you've landed on this page and are a friend of Monica and Steve's, you're in the right place.  If you've happened upon us in Phase Two and are interested in this extremely important Human Rights project to tell the stories of the survivors of sexual violence and how CSJ's advocacy is making a difference, welcome, and we hope you will support us.Here's more about the project:About Michael MatlachMike is a humanitarian photographer who has spent his career exploring the world and bringing back images of its people.  His ability to interact comfortably in situations where compassion and patience is required is one of his strengths.  Some of his portfolio can be found at www.michaelmatlach.comIndia holds a special place in Michael’s heart, having travelled both north and south during his dozen visits, so when he heard about Counsel to Secure Justice and it’s mission, he was compelled to act.  After spending the day with CSJ consultant, Jonathan Derby, he volunteered to give his time to document through photography and video, the challenges and victories of being an advocate for the survivors of sexual violence.What He Needs & What You GetHere’s where you come in – as is often the case, where volunteerism and reality collide, Mike is willing to spend the month of October in India helping document their mission, providing image and video content for their website, collateral material and possible documentary content to be used to raise awareness of their cause, but he needs your help in funding the trip.  Expenses for the airfare, lodging, food and equipment total $5,000. As a thank you for your generous donation, Mike is offering the following:Ø At the $25 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes where he serves as Art Director, so you can send e-cards to celebrate life!  With over 500 global images to choose from (many of them from India), you’ll be sure to find just the right photo, quote and music to express yourself.  More info at: www.harmonywishes.comØ At the $50 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and a scarf from India which Mike will select for you while there and send with a special thank you when he returns.Ø At the $100 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and his fine art print “Washing in the Ganges”, a 6” x 9” image on 8.5” x 11” archival paper. Location: Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, India (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)Ø At the $250 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and two fine art prints “Faded Love: Man” and Faded Love: Woman”, 6” x 9” images on 8.5” x 11” archival paper.  Location: Dungapur, Rajasthan,India  (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)Ø At the $500 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and his most popular image, “A View of the World”, 21” x 33” on 24” x 36” archival paper. Location: Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India  (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)Ø At the $1,000, THE WHOLE ENCHILADA!  HarmonyWishes 20 card pack, ALL prints from each donation level and a huge THANK YOU! All gifts are from the heart.  Namaste.Note: Donations above the $1,575 Phase Two goal will be given to CSJ to support their mission, so don't stop giving!!The ImpactAbout CSJ: CSJ is a young organization that provides survivors of sexual violence free legal and psychosocial support throughout criminal proceedings, from when they report the abuse to police till judgment.  CSJ’s current project focuses on survivors of child sexual abuse in Delhi. CSJ advocates work on the ground—at the police station, hospitals and courts—advising government authorities on the law, supporting clients and monitoring the progress of cases.  They work with trustworthy partners to ensure clients and their families receive the care and support they need to begin healing from the trauma they have suffered. For a short video on CSJ, please check out the video in our Gallery tab.  Their website can be found at www.csjindia.orgThe Facts and Why you should helpThe need for legal support to victims of child sexual abuse is huge· Child sexual abuse is a serious problem in India.  53.2% of children had experienced sexual abuse; 20.9% of children had suffered severe forms of sexual abuse, including rape. These percentages are staggering when you consider India has 1.2 billion people.· More women and girls are coming forward to report sexual abuse in Delhi. Likely because media attention has increased after the gang rape and murder of a 23-year old physiotherapy student in December 2012, there were 1,636 rape cases registered with police in 2013, an increase of 132% from 2012 when 706 rape cases were reported.· Low conviction rates and delayed justice. In 2013, only 27.1% of rape cases in India ended in conviction.  A 2012 CSJ internal study revealed a 20.5% conviction rate in Delhi and criminal proceedings took an average of 28.7 months to complete. Victims and their families need advocates to support and fight for them during criminal proceedings, so justice and healing are possible.You’ve read the statistics.  Now here is a snapshot of CSJ’s cases:Our clients’ average age is 10 ½ years old. We represent ten clients who are six years old and younger.  Two clients are one year old.  We have four gang-rape cases, nine incest cases, one client who has a mental disability, one client who is blind and one who is deaf and mute.  While their stories are disturbing, their vulnerability demonstrates the critical need for CSJ’s legal and psychosocial services.Your money will help us share their stories and give them support“Your presence gave me strength,” Rekha (name changed to protect identity) told CSJ lawyer Eliza Rumthao after she effectively testified against her abuser.  In a basic sense, Rekha’s words illustrate what CSJ does: we support our clients in times of their greatest darkness.  Risks & ChallengesThe challenge of the cultural sensitivities surrounding the topic of sexual violence in India is foremost in everyone's mind.  It's a topic that can be deeply shocking and can illicit deep grief and anger.  The combination of CSJ's experience in advocacy and Mike's genuine compassion will be a formidable force for good!Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if your heart is bigger than your wallet, so if you can’t donate, we’d appreciate you sending out this message to your circle of friends via email, social media or word of mouth. 
“ Never doubt that a small group of committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.” ~ Margaret Mead
Blessings,
Mike and the CSJ team

story:
Pre-orders have shipped. Thank you for your support!

Nomad Kitchens are available and shipping now at www.nomadkitchenco.com

 


The Nomad Kitchen gives you a compact removable kitchen system, great for everyone from the hardcore adventurer to the casual weekend warrior.

Beyond wilderness exploration, the Nomad Kitchen’s uses extend to tailgating, festivals, and emergency preparedness.
 

 


We are outdoor adventure enthusiasts who love exploring new and exciting places to camp, but also found ourselves using our car trunks as gear storage; having camp chairs, sleeping bags, and kitchen supplies on hand is useful for hanging out after activities with friends. We were looking for a way to keep our gear organized and easier to use without giving up all our cargo space or having to compromise being able to cook good food anywhere we go.

After searching for a  better solution the Nomad Kitchen was born. This all-in-one vehicle-mounted system keeps our camp kitchen neat and eliminates the need to pack and unpack so you can make a meal wherever and whenever with ease.
 

 


Here's everything that's included when you order your Nomad Kitchen:

  • Rugged construction built to support up to 200 lbs
  • Heavy-duty slides 
  • Locking drawers

  • Stainless steel washbasin
  • Bamboo cutting board 
  • Space to support water tank (tank sold separately)
  • Accessory hangers for trash bags, utensils, spices, etc.


  • Drying rack
  • Plenty of storage space to keep your gear organized 

Drawer for your favorite two-burner stove (stove sold separately)

Fits any stove with dimensions 14" deep, 23.75" wide, and 4.5" high or less (Dimensions updated on 6/5, more space added for the production model)

Including (but not limited to):

  • Camp Chef: Everest, Rainier, Teton, and Summit
  • Coleman: Triton, Compact, and Classic
  • Eureka: Ignite and Ignite Plus
  • GSI: Selkirk 460 and Selkirk 540
  • Primus: Profile and Kinjia
  • Jetboil: Genesis and HalfGen



Also includes a strap to support a fuel canister!

 


With our custom adjustable strap system, it is as simple to install as hooking in a few ratchet straps. Installing the system requires no tools or permanent modifications to your vehicle.

 

After selecting to place the box on the driver side or passenger side and lifting the box into your trunk you just need to open and loosen the ratchet straps, clip the front strap hooks to the cargo tie-down anchor, and ratchet them until they are snug.

For the back straps, hook the straps into one or two of the rear tie-down anchors (number of tie-down anchors required depending on tie-down locations in your vehicle) and ratchet them until they are snug. 

After that, it’s as easy as unlocking the drawers and sliding them open.

 


We can’t guarantee fit in every car, but in most cases, if your vehicle has three to four tie-down anchor points and a large enough cargo space the Nomad Kitchen will fit.

 

We recommend measuring your trunk to ensure there is enough room using our dimensions: 

- 25.75 inches deep (including the red lock tabs)

- 14.25 inches high (from the top of the trunk sill)

- 22 inches wide (including the ratchets)

Disclaimer: Please ensure your vehicle has enough cargo space and be sure to check the strength rating of your vehicle’s tie-down anchor points before ordering.

 

Nomad Kitchens come with two ¾” leveling risers to help clear small recesses and level the kitchen when parked on uneven ground. However, some vehicles with recessed trunk floors may require an additional riser to allow clearance for the drawers to slide out.

 




If you don't already own a stove or water tank and want to add on one of our options,  make sure you select these during checkout.


“Quite literally, it has everything and the kitchen sink.” - MotorTrend



 


 

The Nomad Kitchen is designed and assembled in California, USA
using domestic materials when available.



Nomad Kitchen Co. equips mobile explorers with high-quality tools to cook the food that fuels their adventures. We empower everyone from weekend warriors to full-time nomads with the freedom to roam.

The kitchen concept is the culmination of decades of cooking and camping experiences, that have taken us from Yosemite to Everest Basecamp and back. This is not to brag, this is our way of saying: we get it.  We hike, we swim, we climb, we bike, and at the start and end of the day, we’re hungry. We want to eat something that’s satisfying, and we want it to be convenient to prep, easy to cook, and quick to clean up. 




Not ready to buy yet? Sign up to be informed of offers and deals from Nomad Kitchen:

Click Here and scroll to the bottom of the page to Join our Mailing List

story:
This ain't your typical backpacking bag... 

We're grateful to be back after 6 successful crowdfunding campaigns, with a bag that we've dreamed of having since we first picked up a camera. 

The FERNWEH is more than a backpacking bag. It's an adventure backpack expertly built for reaching places you’ve never been. It pushes the boundaries of comfort, access, and versatility, no matter where you take it.  

The ROUTE Pack is rugged, sexy, and versatile (a real triple threat). Built for quick access and keeping the elements out, this single-camera body and lens carrying solution integrates with the FERNWEH to be worn on your chest via the quick-release Shoulder Strap attachment or on your hip via the Waist Strap pass through. It's also a killer standalone bag with the included shoulder strap. 

 

 

 

WANDRD wasn't born in a boardroom and it isn't the brainchild of some serial entrepreneurs looking for the next "big thing." No, WANDRD was born from two brothers who weren't satisfied with the status quo. And while we've grown into a thriving team of passionate travelers, photographers, and creators (and a couple of smart asses), the same principles that founded our company run strongly through our veins.   

FERNWEH: Product Overview

 

ROUTE Pack: Feature Overview

 

 

It's nearly impossible to convey comfort in a picture. So close your eyes and imagine getting spooned by a sloth. Now you know what it's like to wear the FERNWEH. 

 Small, thoughtful features can be found all throughout the FERNWEH. Our adjustable, quick-release sternum strap is a great example. It uniquely attaches to either shoulder strap and features a minimalist system without buckles or bulky hardware.

The FERNWEH is just as comfortable backpacking through Europe as it is galavanting through the forest. It works as a carry-on for most US and international flights and the grab handles double as a luggage pass-through. 

Don't worry, we didn't leave out organization for the little things. After all, "snacks" fall into the little things category, and we never EVER forget snacks. 

The bucket organization system creates two compartments for clean organization, or can be removed to allow one spacious compartment. The power lies in your hands. Use it wisely.  

 

 Most companies have a “lifetime” warranty and then creatively explain how a lifetime means 5 years. When we say lifetime, we mean it. All WANDRD products are covered by our WANDER MORE WORRY LESS lifetime warranty. This means that for as long as you own your WANDRD gear, we will make sure your bag is free from manufacturing defects and is functioning properly. We are committed to making the absolute best gear available and are here to back it up.

story:
THE MOST VERSATILE COMPRESSION PACKING CUBES ARE HERE 

Cube Packs were developed with smarter travel in mind. Having the option to fit more essentials into your favorite travel luggage, will make a trip more enjoyable.

 Compression packing cubes are designed to keep travelers organized and tidy. Cube Packs do just that, but also provide additional carrying options after you get to your destination. 

With Cube Packs, not only are you getting the best compression packing cubes ever designed, but you're also getting 3 more packs for everyday carry.

story:
The Hot Seat is the world’s first USB-powered heated seat. Perfect for any season, The Hot Seat will upgrade your painful, backless and unorganized seating into a first-class, comfortable seat, no matter where you are.

The Hot Seat features adjustable USB-powered ThermaGridz™ heating technology, which safely penetrates deep into the body to relax and warm muscles at any event, indoors and out.

If you need some heat, a simple push of a button can make your seat 100 - 115 degrees Fahrenheit.

Even if heat is not needed, take it to the stadium, camping, the beach, the park or a concert - perfect for all seasons!​

As roomy as a first-class airplane seat, Hot Seat’s welded steel frame and patented SoftTushion™ Foam supports and cradles you so you can focus on the event in comfort. Pockets will help keep you organized and your valuables safely close by.

While you're supporting your favorite team or player, let our SoftTushion™ comfort foam support you! The patented foam was designed to be softer and more supportive than other foam chairs. 

 
 
 
Works with any portable battery (not included) and lasts for hours. Simply plug the USB cable into the battery port and charge. When you’re done, stow the cable and controls in the hidden heater control pocket on the front of the right armrest. There is also enough room in the pocket to store a small 2500mAh battery if you want to.
 
 

Are neck and back fatigue cramping your style during the big game? The Hot Seat’s armrests and adjustable chair back support you even during those long games and practices.

Avoid having to crawl under bleachers or having to juggle your valuables along with everything else you need for the game. The Hot Seat has four hidden zippable and expandable pockets to keep everything organized, safe and secure.

I basically created The Hot Seat for myself and thought if it can be of service to me, then other people could have a use for it. too.

The idea for The Hot Seat came to me one day while watching my daughter's softball game and freezing my butt off. I was miserable, uncomfortable and was not enjoying the moment at all! I just wanted to be able to focus on the game and my daughter. There weren't any good solutions out there, so I decided to take my years in product creation and make a solution.

story:
As an experienced bicycle manufacturer located in Shenzhen - the most innovative city in China, we commit to deliver top quality for the most favorable price and we hope Yonos can bring a sense of pleasure & convenience back to riders’ life. Take Yonos home now for just $1299 with free shipping, that is at least 50% cheaper than any other Mid-drive motor e-bikes in the market.Yonos is definitely the coolest and most stunning carbon fiber folding e-bike in 2019! Absolutely the best bike fits into your life!

 

To make sure Yonos can be ridden worldwide, there are two versions available now.  One is 350w motor and 40mph/(65km/h) max. speed, another one is 250w motor and 15.5mph(25km/h) max. speed.

For any European backers, we’ll contact you by email to confirm the version. You can also leave us a message with your requirement. Please feel free to contact us at yonosbike@gmail.com

 

 

  • Mid-drive Motor

Equipped with 350W BAFANG Motor, one of the world's top e-bike motor manufacturers.The  Mid-drive design maintains the highest efficiency every moment. With the low set center of gravity and great dynamic balance, Yonos gives you a smooth stable riding enjoyment.

High starting torque and max torque of more than 80NM, get you uphill more easily and steady on any terrain.

 

  • All-terrain Compatible

Not only the mid-drive motor, but also the 7 speed Shimano gear and all-terrain tires, they are giving the best performance and steadiest ride on any terrain. Maximum speed can go up to 40mph (65km/h). Let go of the speed to enjoy the passion of flying leap ride in the wide without any restriction.

 

  • Carbon Fiber Frame

Yonos e-bike frame is specially made of carbon fiber that is incredibly lightweight and durable. Yet it weighs only 16kg(35lb), 1/3 of aluminum alloy bike, which makes it very easy to carry even with just one hand. It is waterproof, non-deformable and heat resistant that give you multiple layers of protection.

 

  • Foldable Design

The smart design of Yonos is foldable into a mini size bike and can be put in the car truck easily.

After putting it into the truck of a compact car, there is still about half space left.

 

  • Easy to Carry

Lightweight ergonomic design with just only 16kg(35lb), Even girls can pick it up in one hand and easily carry up down the stairs.

 

  • Long Mileage

Yonos comes with a top grade high capacity battery pairing with a quality mid-drive motor makes the bike highly efficient and lasting endurance which allow you to ride up to 100km. Bring along a replacement battery to enjoy an extra 100km ride without a hitch.

 

 

 

  • Better ride handling

Yonos’ Mid-drive motor that is positioned close to the center of gravity and low near the ground. The whole e-bike is usually a little lighter too as the weight is distributed better throughout the bike which provides you a more natural ride experience under any conditions.

 

  • Easier maintenance

For the mid-drive motor, just simply need to unscrew two bolts and you can remove your motor for repairs or replacement. Not like Hub motor which is difficult to repair gear or need to change the tires as the motor is in the rear wheel. However, you won’t need to worry about maintenance issue indeed as Yonos e-bike uses the high-quality BaFang motor which is very durable.

 

  • Higher Performance

The application of power assistance direct to the crank and therefore can take better advantage of the bikes existing gear system. Those gears let mid-drive to work efficiently at different speeds. Higher torque and efficiency of Mid-drive motor improve Yonos e-bike ability to navigate hilly terrain with less effort compared to typical hub-motor bikes. Enable to deliver more power and let us ride for longer range with the same battery.

 

 

 

 

With over 10 years of experience as an OEM of many top bicycle brands, we work with many world top labels of parts and components like Samsung Lithium battery, Shimano (DEORE class) Transmission System, BAFANG motor and ProMax Disc brake etc. We are quality oriented and go to every single detail.

 

  • Shimano Gears

Shimano (DEORE class) 7 Speed Transmission System makes riding more exciting and interesting.

 

  • Smart Bike Computer

Smart waterproof multi-functional bike computer. The speed display allows cyclists to better control bike speed. 6 speed from 0(no assist) to 5(full assist). Choose high Boost to tackle steep climbs. Switch to low Trail to have optimal traction. You’ll experience a much more intuitive carefree ride at any time. There are also power display, mileage display and more to discover!

 

  • Disc Brakes

Front & Rear PreMax Disc Brake for easy emergency braking to prevent accidents.

 

  • Removable Battery

36V 7.8Ah maximum battery capacity with a great performance which manages to travel maximum 100km on one single charge. Removable battery can be fully charged in just 3 hours.

 

  • Safety Guarantee

A variety of security design to make riding more safe & reliable. Highly reduce the risk of injury and accidents while riding.

 

  • Waterproof

IP67 waterproof rating which protected against complete temporary water submersion. Made to withstand all environmental exposures.

  • USB device friendly

Equipped with 2A fast charge USB port. It only takes 75 mins to charge an iPhone and 1.5 hours for a Samsung Galaxy S9.

 

  • No License Needed

Although the Yonos e-bike is equipped with a 350w motor which is actually an auxiliary bicycle. No driving license is required. The adjustable speed also allows you to ride at will. Normally the citywide 20MPH speed limit withstand assisted riding. However, when you are in an area where there’s no legal restrictions, just let go of the speed and enjoy the fun of cycling freely.

 

We’ll make it even easier for you. The Yonos Carbon Fiber E-Bike comes with a three-year global warranty for both the bike’s frame and the motor. For any other damaged components, they can be replaced and ordered from China at any time. Order will be arrived in 5-7 days.

 

 

 

As an experienced bicycle manufacturer located in Shenzhen - the most innovative city in China, we aim to create a leisure, healthy, green, energetic and vitality lifestyle. After years of experimentation and research, we finally found the ideal balance in intelligent, safety, portability, comfort, speed, and of coz FUN. 

Please see what we do in the factory.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Yes, we are a Chinese manufacturer recognized by many bicycle brands as we’ve undertaken many production orders to resolve difficult technical problems in the past 10 years. Even many well-known global brands entrust us with their R&D projects. Yes, we are very proud of that! However, at the same time, we find it a pity that nobody even knows about us or heard of us in the consumer market. Whenever we mention we’re from China, people always associate us to those cheap bicycle sellers on Alibaba what so ever. People may think the bikes may look similar, but we can tell you deep down we are not the same! In fact, for Yonos, bike production is a complex state-of-art implying the pursuit of quality and innovation. It can be very challenging but still, it’s something that we’re always very excited about. Our use of materials, precision, quality, and performance make a huge difference. And we’re proud to say that Yonos is the most outstanding in terms of technology level no matter from process precision, quality assurance to cost control. We’re working hard in product design too and is getting there as you know we have enhanced our interior instead of paying too much attention to the exterior.  We can guarantee and promise to deliver a perfect e-bike to your hands!

In 2019, we want a breakthrough by launching our top products directly to the market. As we’re new in the consumer market, therefore we do hope to gain more recognition thru crowdfunding this time by getting more backings from everyone with unique insight (not just limited to bike lovers). Getting our best products to speak for themselves, we’ll demonstrate our strength and drive for success in this exciting and innovative industry. Your support means a lot to us and will be highly appreciated. In order to show our confidence and gratitude, we will equip each backer with one-on-one customer support (yay give us a shout anytime whenever you need) and offer a 3-years warranty (yay, long-lasting peace of mind). 

Besides, we are so confident about our factory that we’d even like to invite you to our factory tour. :)Yes, we’d love to work with everyone from all over the world and have specially provided a perk for distributors. For those distributors who place a ’distributor perk’ order, we’ll offer them a return air ticket to China for FREE to visit our factory. We’re looking forward to meeting you soon!
story_txt:
As an experienced bicycle manufacturer located in Shenzhen - the most innovative city in China, we commit to deliver top quality for the most favorable price and we hope Yonos can bring a sense of pleasure & convenience back to riders’ life. Take Yonos home now for just $1299 with free shipping, that is at least 50% cheaper than any other Mid-drive motor e-bikes in the market.Yonos is definitely the coolest and most stunning carbon fiber folding e-bike in 2019! Absolutely the best bike fits into your life!
 
To make sure Yonos can be ridden worldwide, there are two versions available now.  One is 350w motor and 40mph/(65km/h) max. speed, another one is 250w motor and 15.5mph(25km/h) max. speed.
For any European backers, we’ll contact you by email to confirm the version. You can also leave us a message with your requirement. Please feel free to contact us at yonosbike@gmail.com
 

 
Mid-drive Motor

Equipped with 350W BAFANG Motor, one of the world's top e-bike motor manufacturers.The  Mid-drive design maintains the highest efficiency every moment. With the low set center of gravity and great dynamic balance, Yonos gives you a smooth stable riding enjoyment.

High starting torque and max torque of more than 80NM, get you uphill more easily and steady on any terrain.
 
All-terrain Compatible


Not only the mid-drive motor, but also the 7 speed Shimano gear and all-terrain tires, they are giving the best performance and steadiest ride on any terrain. Maximum speed can go up to 40mph (65km/h). Let go of the speed to enjoy the passion of flying leap ride in the wide without any restriction.
 
Carbon Fiber Frame

Yonos e-bike frame is specially made of carbon fiber that is incredibly lightweight and durable. Yet it weighs only 16kg(35lb), 1/3 of aluminum alloy bike, which makes it very easy to carry even with just one hand. It is waterproof, non-deformable and heat resistant that give you multiple layers of protection.

 
Foldable Design

The smart design of Yonos is foldable into a mini size bike and can be put in the car truck easily.
After putting it into the truck of a compact car, there is still about half space left.

 
Easy to Carry

Lightweight ergonomic design with just only 16kg(35lb), Even girls can pick it up in one hand and easily carry up down the stairs.
 
Long Mileage

Yonos comes with a top grade high capacity battery pairing with a quality mid-drive motor makes the bike highly efficient and lasting endurance which allow you to ride up to 100km. Bring along a replacement battery to enjoy an extra 100km ride without a hitch.
 

 

 

Better ride handling
Yonos’ Mid-drive motor that is positioned close to the center of gravity and low near the ground. The whole e-bike is usually a little lighter too as the weight is distributed better throughout the bike which provides you a more natural ride experience under any conditions.

 
Easier maintenance
For the mid-drive motor, just simply need to unscrew two bolts and you can remove your motor for repairs or replacement. Not like Hub motor which is difficult to repair gear or need to change the tires as the motor is in the rear wheel. However, you won’t need to worry about maintenance issue indeed as Yonos e-bike uses the high-quality BaFang motor which is very durable.

 
Higher Performance
The application of power assistance direct to the crank and therefore can take better advantage of the bikes existing gear system. Those gears let mid-drive to work efficiently at different speeds. Higher torque and efficiency of Mid-drive motor improve Yonos e-bike ability to navigate hilly terrain with less effort compared to typical hub-motor bikes. Enable to deliver more power and let us ride for longer range with the same battery.

 

 

 

 


With over 10 years of experience as an OEM of many top bicycle brands, we work with many world top labels of parts and components like Samsung Lithium battery, Shimano (DEORE class) Transmission System, BAFANG motor and ProMax Disc brake etc. We are quality oriented and go to every single detail.
 

Shimano Gears

Shimano (DEORE class) 7 Speed Transmission System makes riding more exciting and interesting.
 
Smart Bike Computer

Smart waterproof multi-functional bike computer. The speed display allows cyclists to better control bike speed. 6 speed from 0(no assist) to 5(full assist). Choose high Boost to tackle steep climbs. Switch to low Trail to have optimal traction. You’ll experience a much more intuitive carefree ride at any time. There are also power display, mileage display and more to discover!
 
Disc Brakes


Front & Rear PreMax Disc Brake for easy emergency braking to prevent accidents.
 
Removable Battery

36V 7.8Ah maximum battery capacity with a great performance which manages to travel maximum 100km on one single charge. Removable battery can be fully charged in just 3 hours.
 
Safety Guarantee


A variety of security design to make riding more safe & reliable. Highly reduce the risk of injury and accidents while riding.
 
Waterproof

IP67 waterproof rating which protected against complete temporary water submersion. Made to withstand all environmental exposures.
USB device friendly

Equipped with 2A fast charge USB port. It only takes 75 mins to charge an iPhone and 1.5 hours for a Samsung Galaxy S9.
 
No License Needed
Although the Yonos e-bike is equipped with a 350w motor which is actually an auxiliary bicycle. No driving license is required. The adjustable speed also allows you to ride at will. Normally the citywide 20MPH speed limit withstand assisted riding. However, when you are in an area where there’s no legal restrictions, just let go of the speed and enjoy the fun of cycling freely.
 

We’ll make it even easier for you. The Yonos Carbon Fiber E-Bike comes with a three-year global warranty for both the bike’s frame and the motor. For any other damaged components, they can be replaced and ordered from China at any time. Order will be arrived in 5-7 days.
 

 

 
As an experienced bicycle manufacturer located in Shenzhen - the most innovative city in China, we aim to create a leisure, healthy, green, energetic and vitality lifestyle. After years of experimentation and research, we finally found the ideal balance in intelligent, safety, portability, comfort, speed, and of coz FUN. 

Please see what we do in the factory.


 



 


 

 

 
 

 
Yes, we are a Chinese manufacturer recognized by many bicycle brands as we’ve undertaken many production orders to resolve difficult technical problems in the past 10 years. Even many well-known global brands entrust us with their R&D projects. Yes, we are very proud of that! However, at the same time, we find it a pity that nobody even knows about us or heard of us in the consumer market. Whenever we mention we’re from China, people always associate us to those cheap bicycle sellers on Alibaba what so ever. People may think the bikes may look similar, but we can tell you deep down we are not the same! In fact, for Yonos, bike production is a complex state-of-art implying the pursuit of quality and innovation. It can be very challenging but still, it’s something that we’re always very excited about. Our use of materials, precision, quality, and performance make a huge difference. And we’re proud to say that Yonos is the most outstanding in terms of technology level no matter from process precision, quality assurance to cost control. We’re working hard in product design too and is getting there as you know we have enhanced our interior instead of paying too much attention to the exterior.  We can guarantee and promise to deliver a perfect e-bike to your hands!

In 2019, we want a breakthrough by launching our top products directly to the market. As we’re new in the consumer market, therefore we do hope to gain more recognition thru crowdfunding this time by getting more backings from everyone with unique insight (not just limited to bike lovers). Getting our best products to speak for themselves, we’ll demonstrate our strength and drive for success in this exciting and innovative industry. Your support means a lot to us and will be highly appreciated. In order to show our confidence and gratitude, we will equip each backer with one-on-one customer support (yay give us a shout anytime whenever you need) and offer a 3-years warranty (yay, long-lasting peace of mind).

story:
Getting kids outside is good...

The research is overwhelming. Outdoor programs improve overall health, reduce anxiety, raise test scores, transcend language barriers, and teach critical life skills. Outdoor skills are life skills – leadership, collaboration, resource management, and decision-making cultivated in the outdoors translate seamlessly to all aspects of life! It’s no wonder teachers, parents, youth leaders, and schools want these programs in their curriculum.

...but getting kids outside is hard...

Ever planned a group camping trip? It's tough. Arranging transportation, collecting gear, obtaining permits, and calculating just the right amount of food – all before the trip even starts! It’s even harder for a school or a church or a youth organization - now you need insurance, liability waivers, evacuation plans, and a way to move a lot of young people around.

...and getting kids outside is expensive.

Most outdoor programs run upwards of $250/per person/day. That's a lot for anyone, let alone a teacher looking to provide an experience for an entire class. We can cut that price in half. 

 

B.O.A.T.  makes getting outside easy.

The Bus for Outdoor Access and Teaching is an outdoor program…on wheels. While your typical outdoor program runs trips out of a warehouse, garage, or facility, our entire operation – from business administration to trip transportation – runs out of a bus. This allows us to reach more people right where they live, while offering trips for a substantially lower cost than traditional outdoor programs.

This is an especially huge benefit to organizations - by working with us they get an outdoor program on site, resolving the complications of running a trip while outsourcing liability and risk to an experienced 3rd party.

With the BOAT, you get a smooth ride and an all-inclusive adventure. We even take care of the liability - it's like having your own outdoor program right where you work or live.

We know all about O.A.T. But we need a B(us). 

We’re seven current and former outdoor educators looking for a better way to connect American kids with the wilderness around them by addressing common hurdles in accessibility.

Three of us started an outdoor adventure company  (it's still running successfully). One of us has already converted and built vehicles. We have a Leave No Trace Master, a National Geographic naturalist, and one of us works for Google which is definitely cool. We even have a registered 501c(3) - so if you donate we can get you receipts for tax deductions by the end of the year. 

What we don't have is the bus - and that's why we need you. 

 

At this stage of the journey...

...we have a non-profit. Our logistical, risk management, and emergency protocols are in place. We know how much food to buy for a trip, what kind of gear we need, and how to take care of it. Our experienced education team can turn wilderness areas into classrooms for pretty much anything - math, social justice, history. 

We even know what we want the bus to look like - we just don't have it. 


 

 

...help us get over the next peak!

We hope to raise $6,000 to serve as the down payment on a quality bus. Anything we raise beyond that will go towards our $66,345 budget, every detail of which you can see here. We haven't picked a bus out yet, but we know what we want in the most important member of our team. 

The campaign you are looking at right now is our chance to kick it off. Any and all seed funding helps - we can take out a loan for a bus and start reaching out to grants, donors, and others. The more we raise now, the better the start (and the quicker we get on the road!). 

"I love it, this is cool, count me in!"

Great! We love you! You're cool! You're in! There are a few ways you can help us - first donate! And then take a gander at our website for more!

 

Eh... I'm not sold yet.

Cool beans. It happens - can we ask why not?

Will it work? A bus? Is that really big enough?

Definitely. We've already prototyped this model, running programs out of vehicles on multiple trips. The downside was that these vehicles were small - it wasn't comfortable, even if it brought real value to the organizations we partnered with. 

We also know the bus can work - we've seen similar buses in action, though none of them were used for programs available to the public. Ours will be. 

 

What makes this so much more affordable?

Two things. The first is that we avoid facilities (and maintenance, repair, property tax, etc...). While the bus does present ongoing costs, so does any vehicle solution used by a similar program. 

But the biggest cost savings is in our partnership based model. Camps and programs that recruit individuals spend a tremendous amount of money and time recruiting those people and their families. By partnering with organizations we cut down on that outreach expense, and can pass those savings onto the kids. 

 

Tell me everything, I want all the details.

Hey, we love the curiosity. Why don't you take a look at this more detailed business plan and see what you think afterwards? Note that it's still a draft, but we're willing to share. 

 

Are you in? Then get on the BOAT, donate, and share!

All donations to the Bus for Outdoor Access & Teaching are considered charitable contributions and tax-deductible pending the approval of our 501(c)(3) application by the IRS, which we fully expect within the 2018 tax year.

campaign_city: Where the roads meet the wilds, United States

story:
After five years in development Jumpack is ready to launch!

You may have already seen Jumpack under some of the best riders on earth including current World Champions and Nitro Circus Athletes and now, you can own one too!

Jumpack will change the way you ride forever…

 

 

 

  • At only 6kg Jumpack is designed to be carried like a backpack as you ride, skate or scoot from location to location.
  • A 'Transformer' style deployment action allows Jumpack to be set up in a matter of seconds without the requirement for assembly at location.
  • Patented Anti-Slide technology incorporates two custom dampening units to ensure the ramp holds its position during use.

 

'Jumpack is the most technically advanced ramp system on earth and a 'must-have' product for all action sports enthusiasts'

 

 

Jumpack has Patent Granted in the US and Europe and has a multitude of ingenious design features that makes the product work so well. 

 

 

The 'Game-Changing' potential that Jumpack brings has also caught the attention of major media organisations resulting in coverage across Print, Digital & Online!

 

Jumpack featured in Red Bulletin Magazine

 

 

Our story so far has been quite amazing!

 

In 2016 the Jumpack concept won Northern Ireland's largest and most prestigious innovation competition ‘Invent 2016’. 

Later that year Jumpack competed against over 400 companies to reach the final of Pitch @ Palace 6.0, a UK wide competition organised by the British Royal Family.

We were even invited to meet Queen Elizabeth II and tell her a little about the Jumpack project.

In 2019 Jumpack is announced 'Best Start-Up Company in Northern Ireland' by IntertradeIreland Seedcorn.

 

 

Inventor Phil McIntosh provides an introduction to Jumpack

Action Sports celebrities put Jumpack to the Jump test

 

Jumpack has already been tested by some of the biggest names in action sports including current World Champions, Nitro Circus riders and some of YouTube's most popular extreme sports stars with over 1m views in just a few months.

BMX Riders Spencer Foresman & Chase Pauza take Jumpack for a test flight.

 

Pro Skateboarder John Hill takes Jumpack onto the Streets of NYC.

 
The TIPSBMX Channel hold a Jumpack 'long-Jump' competition in Spain
(in Spanish)
 
UK Scooter Champion Jamie Hull demonstrates the versatility of Jumpack
 
 
 
 

 

'No Limits' is now a reality..

 

 

 

 

Outside of being one of the first people on earth to own a Jumpack, you will have helped to ‘breathe life’ into one of the most game-changing products to hit extreme sports since the GoPro camera.

 

To accompany your portable kicker you will also receive a super-low buy price at 30% below RRP and a FREE GoPro attachment worth $12.99.

 

Get an amazing product at a 'one-off' price..

 

How you can help us

Now that we have perfected and tested Jumpack we want to make it available to everyone, not just the sports stars that have helped with our testing program.

To do this we require your help. The development of Jumpack has been expensive, the manufacture of the required tooling was more expensive again. But now we’re ready.

All we require is the funding to purchase the materials required to start immediate production of ramps. This will result in quick delivery times for our backers.

 

You Don’t Ride or Skate?

It’s cool if you don’t ride or skate, there are other ways you can help.

Do you have a friend, son, daughter, brother, sister, niece, nephew, next-door neighbor who does? Tell them about us. We guarantee that when they see Jumpack, they’ll want one.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to share quickly and easily.

 

Over the past five years Jumpack has evolved from an idea, to a concept and finally to a perfected product.

A lightweight ramp that can be transported in its own custom backpack and ‘unfolded’ transformer style into a kicker ramp without the requirement for assembly before use.

 

 

Phil McIntosh - Product Design

Hey everyone, let me tell you a little about myself. I was born in 1970 so I'm a child of the Evel Knievel generation. As such, I had little choice but to ride and jump bikes from a very early age.

In the 1980’s, I became a Northern Ireland BMX Champion, in the 90’s a multiple Downhill Mountain Bike Champion, and in the 2000’s I even became an All-Ireland Downhill Mountain Bike Champion.

Jumping bikes is what I loved then, and what I still love now.

 
Phil in 1982 

 

   

Phil with Jumpack in 2018    

 

Sheldon Jimenez - Manufacturing & Materials Expert

Sheldon is a graduate of Manufacturing Engineering and Management and is currently a Senior Project Engineer at RP Group Limited

As a Project Engineer, he is responsible for helping clients develop their products from prototype to mass production. He focuses on collaborating with customers to ensure their requirements are executed and standards are met.

 

 

Alan Eustace - Logistics Specialist at TBM Solution
Headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, TBM Solution is part of Soundzdirect Ltd, established in 2011. TBM utilise their own, custom created, platform and a global network of 3PL partners to allow companies optimise their supply chain. This is done via a wide range of services including warehousing, logistics, customer services, marketplace management and ecommerce services for B2B and B2C.  www.tbm-solution.com      

 

 

              

Mike Crowe - Customer Service

A keen mountain bike rider, Mike has over 20 years experience in product retail and has taken care of thousands of customers around the world. Mike will be on hand to ensure that every backer enjoys the optimum Jumpack experience and provide ongoing product support whenever it's required.

 

In 2013 I watched three young BMX riders struggle to move a make-shift ramp comprising of a large wooden board loaded with bricks to a nearby park.

It brought back memories of the times that I’d had to do the same with my BMX friends all those years ago. What hit me though, was that our 'common' experience was 30 years apart.

It appeared that BMX riders today were facing the same problem that we’d faced almost three decades earlier. Surely there was a portable ramp option out there that riders and skaters could take with them everywhere they go?

As it turned out, there wasn’t and as a qualified engineer, I decided that it was time for this to change. The development of Jumpack began.

Ramp technology has remained the same for decades.

 

Exciting times are ahead

The excitement that surrounds this product is not misplaced as the impact of Jumpack world-wide is going to be huge.

Jumpack will change the extreme sports world forever. It allows participants in BMX, Skateboarding, Scooters, Mountain Biking, In-line Skating and even Snowboarding to create a jump spot anywhere in seconds.

It changes the way you see your environment and it offers endless potential to those that engage in extreme sports.

 

The risks involved in backing Jumpack are negligible as all development, tool production and testing has already been completed.

The funding we require is simply to manufacture ramps, ramps to send to you and people just like you.

Our tooling is ready, all we require is funding to purchase the materials to manufacture your ramps.

 

Every ramp comes with a no quibble guarantee against manufacturing or material defects.

This will result in quick delivery times for our backers. You Don’t Ride or Skate?It’s cool if you don’t ride or skate, there are other ways you can help.Do you have a friend, son, daughter, brother, sister, niece, nephew, next-door neighbor who does? Tell them about us. We guarantee that when they see Jumpack, they’ll want one.Use the Indiegogo share tools to share quickly and easily. Over the past five years Jumpack has evolved from an idea, to a concept and finally to a perfected product.A lightweight ramp that can be transported in its own custom backpack and ‘unfolded’ transformer style into a kicker ramp without the requirement for assembly before use.  Phil McIntosh - Product DesignHey everyone, let me tell you a little about myself. I was born in 1970 so I'm a child of the Evel Knievel generation. As such, I had little choice but to ride and jump bikes from a very early age.In the 1980’s, I became a Northern Ireland BMX Champion, in the 90’s a multiple Downhill Mountain Bike Champion, and in the 2000’s I even became an All-Ireland Downhill Mountain Bike Champion.Jumping bikes is what I loved then, and what I still love now. Phil in 1982     Phil with Jumpack in 2018     Sheldon Jimenez - Manufacturing & Materials ExpertSheldon is a graduate of Manufacturing Engineering and Management and is currently a Senior Project Engineer at RP Group LimitedAs a Project Engineer, he is responsible for helping clients develop their products from prototype to mass production. He focuses on collaborating with customers to ensure their requirements are executed and standards are met.  Alan Eustace - Logistics Specialist at TBM SolutionHeadquartered in Dublin, Ireland, TBM Solution is part of Soundzdirect Ltd, established in 2011. TBM utilise their own, custom created, platform and a global network of 3PL partners to allow companies optimise their supply chain. This is done via a wide range of services including warehousing, logistics, customer services, marketplace management and ecommerce services for B2B and B2C.  www.tbm-solution.com                      Mike Crowe - Customer ServiceA keen mountain bike rider, Mike has over 20 years experience in product retail and has taken care of thousands of customers around the world. Mike will be on hand to ensure that every backer enjoys the optimum Jumpack experience and provide ongoing product support whenever it's required. In 2013 I watched three young BMX riders struggle to move a make-shift ramp comprising of a large wooden board loaded with bricks to a nearby park.It brought back memories of the times that I’d had to do the same with my BMX friends all those years ago. What hit me though, was that our 'common' experience was 30 years apart.It appeared that BMX riders today were facing the same problem that we’d faced almost three decades earlier. Surely there was a portable ramp option out there that riders and skaters could take with them everywhere they go?As it turned out, there wasn’t and as a qualified engineer, I decided that it was time for this to change. The development of Jumpack began.Ramp technology has remained the same for decades. Exciting times are aheadThe excitement that surrounds this product is not misplaced as the impact of Jumpack world-wide is going to be huge.Jumpack will change the extreme sports world forever. It allows participants in BMX, Skateboarding, Scooters, Mountain Biking, In-line Skating and even Snowboarding to create a jump spot anywhere in seconds.It changes the way you see your environment and it offers endless potential to those that engage in extreme sports. The risks involved in backing Jumpack are negligible as all development, tool production and testing has already been completed.The funding we require is simply to manufacture ramps, ramps to send to you and people just like you.Our tooling is ready, all we require is funding to purchase the materials to manufacture your ramps. Every ramp comes with a no quibble guarantee against manufacturing or material defects.

story:
NOMATIC was born and raised on through crowdfunding. In 2014 we launched the BASICS Wallet, in 2015 the BASICS Notebook, in 2016 The NOMATIC Travel Bag, in 2017 The NOMATIC Backpack and Travel Pack, and the beginning of this year The NOMATIC Messenger and Laptop bag. All of these past products are available at www.nomatic.com

We have shipped over 50,000 bags to customers all over the world. NOMATIC is quickly becoming a brand known for its highly functional bags and exceptional quality. Here is what our customers are saying about our Products:

At NOMATIC we create the most functional gear ever to inspire confidence for life on the move. We love creating innovative products that help people simplify, organize, and improve their lives. We are so grateful to all of our backers and supporters who have helped us successfully bring 8 products to life. Thanks for all of your support!

PRODUCT WARRANTY

Here at NOMATIC, we stand behind all of our products. If we can't fix or repair a manufacture defect, we will replace the product, no questions asked.

RETURN POLICY

We offer a 30 day no risk return policy. If you are not 100% satisfied with the quality of the product within 30 Days of receiving your order, simply send it back and we will refund you, no questions asked. But don't worry, we know you are going to love it!

CUSTOMS & DUTIES INFORMATION

NOMATIC cannot mark orders as gifts. This is illegal, so we will not be able to do this.

Our prices DO NOT include VAT, GST or other country taxes.

As many of you know, our terms of sale for international orders are FOB destination. This means that you pay all freight and duties or taxes. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Indiegogo.

We found this handy tool, that can assist you in calculating duties. Remember to convert the U.S. dollars to your local currency:

https://www.simplyduty.com/import-calculator/

For international customers who are required to pay customs, you will receive an email from your local customs authorities asking for payment to have your order processed through customs. Unfortunately, there is no legal way around customs. Once you make that payment to the customs broker your order will be processed for final delivery.

SHIPPING POLICY

If our shipping carrier attempts delivery to you and you don't get it because you’re not there, wrong address, moved without notifying us, and the package returns back to our warehouse, it will be the buyer's responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. When you receive your tracking #, please keep an eye out for the package.

story:
This is gonna be sweet

Howdy y'all. We'd like to make jerseys for our blog, and this seems to be the best way to collect the money. If not enough people are interested, then we won't do it and nobody gets charged. If enough people are interested, then we do do it and we all get sweet as heck jerseys. Here's what we're looking at for the front:

Hell yeah, look at that cool-ass bear. Here's what the shoulders are gonna look like:

Blog logo. Nothing too fancy but whatever. It's a shoulder logo, and it's a good one.

As for the jersey itself? Oh, nothing too fancy, just a #TeamPooh blank (!!!)

Oooooh baby. So this should be sweet. If you're not excited by this point, I can't help you.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal:

  • Get a jersey with totally sweet pro-style lettering (in the style of the #TeamPooh jersey) for $190 USD
  • Get a jersey with heat-sealed lettering (iron-on letters, looks like maybe a rec league team jersey maybe) for $130 USD
  • Get a jersey without your name or a number but with the logos on the front and shoulder for $100 USD

And that’s all there is to it. We need at least 10 people to buy jerseys to make it feasible, so if you're on the fence feel free to let us give you a little push.

story:
Our beautiful city of Waterloo is world renowned for many things, from prestigious universities, award winning think tanks, to a blossoming science and technology haven. We know this city has so much to offer to people who live here and visitors alike.

We've noticed that such a tremendous city like this is missing what so many cities around the world have, a bike share! Biking is fun, green, and convenient!

Grand River Public Bike Share Inc, (GRPBS)  began with an idea to bring this type of sustainable transportation to Waterloo. The idea has grown into a dedicated group of volunteers from all backgrounds building a bike share in our amazing city.

Now we need your help to build the system and bring it to life.  Not only will you be supporting the building of 2 bike stations in the city, as a contributor you will get some amazing perks, our appreciation,  and the satisfaction of helping to build a something that improves our great city.

Grand River Public Bike Share

Ride Share Save


How it Works

1.  Registration

Register once (name, address, mobile phone number). At your future rentals, our system will identify you with your phone number!

2.  Rent a Bike

To rent a bike, please call the hotline number you will find on the bike. After entering the bike number into your phone you'll get the code to open the combination lock on the bike.

3.  Return

Return the bikes to an official station. Lock one wheel with the lock and scramble the numbers on the combination lock. After that call the hotline or use the app to tell us about the bike's return, and that's it!


Fee Structure



What We need & What you Get


We've put in the hard work and now we need your help to achieve our goal of raising $23, 500 to:

  • Fund the building of two stations and 10 bikes in the downtown core.
  • If we raise more funds we can build more of our 10 station 100 bike system.
  • Buy the bicycles; secure, safe, and sleek 4th generation bikes and to create the necessary infrastructure.
  • Increase the awareness and use of our bike share.

An artist's rendition of a GRPBS bike station.

The Impact


A map of the system. The green bikes represent proposed stations, the yellow bikes are future stations suggested by our supporters.

Waterloo is a great city to live and work in but we think there are ways to make moving around the city easier! Imagine using one of our bikes to run some errands around town, meet up with some friends all while experiencing the city as only a cyclist can.

Like all good ideas, we already have a group of enthusiastic supporters, but to grow we need you to support GRPBS with your donations to help us build something green and great!

Our Bikes

1. Seat with theft protection
2. Aluminium seat post
3. Aluminium handle bar system
4. Robust alloy basket with integrated chain lock and front light
5. Front wheel mudguard incl. splash guard
6. LED front light with stand light function
7. Steel fork with roller brake
8. Shimano hub-dynamo
9. Light alloy V-profile rims
10. Puncture resistant tires with reflective strips
11. Aluminium pedals
12. Robust Aluminium side stand
13. Shimano 3-speed hub gear
14. LED back light with standard function
15. Stable chain guard
16. Board computer
17. Weight 16.2 kg


Our Perks

                                         

A daily pass to use our system with a $10 donation, will you have as much fun as the people in the photo only you can decide! Monthly and yearly passes are also available with donations of $25 and above.

A branded pen and a T-shirt as part of $25 dollar donation.

Our limited Pack (blue and white) and Breakaway (green) membership cards available with donations of $50 and above.

                                          

The exclusive Sprinter membership card available with donations of $500.

Just remember the final look of the perks may vary.

Press

We've made a name for ourselves find out what the wider community has been saying about GRPBS.

To read article click here.                            To read article click here.

    
To listen click here.

To read article click here.                                       To read article click here.   To listen to interview click here.                                To watch video click here.

                                                   
                                                         To read click here.
                                                  

                                                         To read click here.   


Our Team

Meet the people who, with your help, will make the dream happen.

Prasad Samarakoon, Executive Director - Hi everyone, I founded Grand River Public Bike Share in 2012 and serve as Executive Director. I have been living in the Waterloo Region and raising my family for the last 10 years. After initiating this project with four of my friends, GRPBS have grown into a dedicated group of volunteers. I am a licensed Professional Engineer in Ontario, and a graduate of the University of Peradeniya, Sri Lanka with degree in Bachelors of Science in Civil Engineering.

Chitral Angammana, Director of Technology and Operations - I'm Chitral and a founding member of GRPBS. I am responsible for leading the organization technology development strategy including web and application development. I'm a green energy enthusiast and have extensive experience in Energy, Environment, and Climate change research. I received my PhD from the University of Waterloo in Electrical and Computer Engineering, specializing in Nanotechnology.

Maurice Kumalo, Manager Fundraising and Marketing Campaigns - Traveling around  the world I have seen some places with fantastic infrastructure. I really enjoyed living and visiting in places were bicycles were part of city life, Copenhagen, Nice, and Nagoya come to mind. When I found out that Grand River Public Bike Share wanted to build a bike share in Waterloo I leaped at the chance to join. I have an MBA from EDHEC Business School and a B.A. (Honor's) from the University of Western Ontario.

Sean Boisse, Manager, Business Development and Finance - I'm a recent grad of the University of Waterloo and understand that the Mr. Noodles and beer diet is a budgetary constraint and not a matter of preference (except for maybe the beer). I've been working on designing a system that is affordable for everyone without compromising on outstanding service. I have held a number of financial positions in Toronto and now am a Risk Analyst at a local financial institution. As an avid biker I would love to see more Waterluvians on two wheels.

Anthony Milito, Marketing Team Leader - I am a strong believer that amazing marketing starts with amazing products and that when the two come together they can make the world a better place. That’s why I joined the Grand River Public Bike Share Team. Since coming on board I have been focused on developing a marketing and sponsorship plan that is designed to promote and grow this sustainable, efficient, and green method of transportation for the region. I was born and raised in the region, and am a graduate of WLU and a Marketing Manager at a local tech giant.

Kara Sharp, Communications Analyst - I'm currently attending the University of Waterloo for Sports Business and am in charge of communications at GRPBS; meaning PR, external communications, maintaining our social media presence, including blog posts and our newsletter to our our supporters in the community. In the future I hope to see active transportation all around Canada.

Sean McGrath, Transportation Planner - It's a real honour and a great opportunity to be involved with GRPBS, helping to provide and enhance active transportation in Waterloo Region. GRPBS is a innovative organization, promoting the Region's image, engaging local businesses and municipalities while providing a public good. I take pride in being associated with GRPBS and look forward to it's successful launch in the coming months.

Rachel Tucker, Transportation Planner - I graduated from the University of Waterloo in 2013 with an Environmental Studies, Honours Planning degree. I was drawn to the bike share project because I think, it is extremely important to further develop multi-modal transportation within the Region of Waterloo to reduce automobile use. I am conducting a demographic study on the city of Waterloo and will be assisting in creating a station study. I am also working with a team to determine bike station locations to create the strongest network possible.

Sherry Xue Qin, Transportation Planner - I received my Masters degree in Geography from the University of Western Ontario. My three years' experience in GIS strengthened my skills in map design and digitization, geo-spatial data analysis, and spatial planning. I volunteer at Grand River Public Bike Share as a Transportation Planner, which gives me a great opportunity to integrate my expertise with my interests. I am responsible for creating GIS maps to visualize the relation between the locations and demography and analyzing potential locations of bike stations for GRPBS program.

Pavit Kaur, Business Analyst - I am passionate about the pro bono movement leading to active and positive social change. Being part of this industrious team, I am committed to streamlining processes for more efficient implementation of the movement. I have Master’s in Management from University of Waterloo and strongly believe Grand River Public Bike Share will make the city of Waterloo a healthier, greener and connected place marking a lasting step towards a sustainable growth.

Purvi Koradia, Web Developer - Hi, Purvi here, I have a Masters in Computer Application from India and moved in Canada almost two years ago now. Currently, I volunteer as Web Developer in GRPBS, developing, maintaining, and improving our website and its functionality. I also studied courses in Advance Web Development from Conestoga College and online iOS developer course from the University of Waterloo.

Sawsan Mahmoud, Manager of Policy Development - I am a University of Waterloo graduate with a Master's degree in Management Science Engineering. I've worked in the management consultancy field for eight years with experience in quality management, project management, leadership, and training. I have strong belief that believing in an idea, always turns it into reality. This is why I have joined Grand River Public Bike Share.  My research includes innovation management, local community development; so I’m full of passion for community serving initiatives. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like or share our message on Facebook, Twitter, email, and of course Indiegogo!
  • Volunteer; we are always looking for motivated people to help make a bike share in Waterloo a dream come true.
  • Visit our homepage. For your support you have our thanks and some

story:
Short Summary

After an early spring 2016 cruise, it was discovered that the area above one of our propeller shaft struts is leaking. The only way to properly address this repair and verify that no other damage exists to the hull, propeller shaft or propeller is to haul the boat out of the water. A recent visual inspection by a hull cleaning service shows that the bottom is in need of repainting and the damage indicates the shaft and propeller are in need of servicing.

Our current funds will not cover the entire cost of these repairs. Local industry professionals have offered trained technical staff to oversee our repairs. The best offer we have received from a local shipyard is more than our finances will currently handle. This offer does not cover the cost of materials necessary to complete the repairs.

The Pacific Youth Boating Association, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization and Sponsor of the Sea Scout Ship Conquest, is running this campaign, among others, to help raise funds to cover these costs. Please help us insure that the centerpiece of our program – the Conquest – remains safe and trouble-free for years to come.

What We Need

Our repairs, which will be funded through this campaign, include:

  • Haul Out at a local shipyard.
  • Examination of the areas in need of repair.
  • Clean and paint the bottom.
  • Replace one thru-hull and install two new thru-hulls and valves.
  • Repair strut plate
  • Replace strut bearings.
  • True shaft.
  • Balance or replace propeller.
  • Replace shaft seal.
  • Strip, prep and paint hull and boot top.
  • Strip, prep and paint cabin, pilothouse and signal mast.
  • Replace name graphic
  • Replace sacrificial zincs.
  • Repair handrails.

To complete this project we will need to make several purchases, including:

Haul-out services at a local yard. (We have located only a couple of local yards that will allow us to do our own work.)

  • Bottom paint
  • Topside paint
  • Painting supplies
  • Resin
  • Fiberglass cloth and roving
  • Cabosil (Powder fill)
  • Strut Bearings
  • Propeller
  • Zincs
  • Welding services
  • Name graphic

If this project does not reach full funding, any funds collected will be used entirely to support whatever work on the Conquest can be done. 

Conquest

Conquest is a former U.S. Navy Utility Boat. Built by the Harbor Boatbuilding Company in Long Beach, CA in 1965, she served aboard the USS Samuel Gompers (AD-37) from 1967 until 1989. Transferred to the Sea Scouts in Stockton, CA , she was later acquired by the Pacific Youth Boating Association in 1995 and transported to Long Beach. Since then, the Sea Scouts, with help from industry professionals, have transformed the empty hull into a cruising boat that is one of the most active boats in the Long Beach Sea Scout Squadron. Since her launch in 2003, she has made many cruises to points like Catalina Island, San Diego and other Southern California ports. She has also carried her crew on annual summer long cruises to the Channel Islands and other, farther points. In 2012 and 2015 our summer cruise visited San Francisco and Sacramento, a cruise of 12 days and 957 miles.

The Impact

The Pacific Youth Boating Association supports Sea Scouting in Long Beach through its sponsorship of the Sea Scout Ship Conquest.  

Chartered since 1963, the Sea Scout Ship Conquest provides an exciting program of good citizenship, education, leadership, seamanship, cruising and adventure for young men and women age 14 – 21. This unique program prepares them to make good ethical and moral choices over their lifetime as they learn the values of the Sea Promise, Scout Oath and Scout Law

Other Ways You Can Help

No matter if you are able to donate, or can't donate, please forward this campaign to everyone you know who supports Sea Scouting, or wants to ensure that our local youth continue to learn through boating. Thank You.

Additional information about the Ship 564 can be found at: www.ship564.com

Thank you for your support!

story:
So here's the thing...

I've got no eloquent spiel OR fancy campaign for you kiddos. The nitty gritty is that God is doing very real and heavy things in my heart lately and He will not LEAVE ME BE until I am obedient in what I know He has called me to do in this season of my life. My heart has been breaking the last few months in my own selfishness and striving and frankly it's just time that my heart break for the things that really matter to the kingdom of God. I believe my dreams are God given but they have to MEAN something. Call it deep or overly spiritual but I'm living my truth today in that I don't want to leave this earth without knowing I laid some things down for the one who laid it all down for me. We as a human race are a family, that's how God sees us. Far and wide we need to take care of each other.
Fear has told me at least 50 reasons why I shouldn't go but faith tells me to trust that God will not only do a mighty work in me but a mighty work through me. I so badly want to work out His plan for my life and this is part of it.  This is clearly God's idea...so, I'm going. Help...no seriously help. 

Let me break it down...

My birthday is in August... the month of my trip! So, in lieu of taking me out to drinks and twerks, or buying me a gift I ask that you donate to my mission. The money received will go to additional expenses and will allow me to personally and directly help individuals and families in Kenya. I'll actually get to see where your money is going. LET'S PLEASE HELP AS MANY PEOPLE AS POSSIBLE.

The Impact

My prayer is that this trip will do more than is monetarily possible as I will be  visiting refugee camps, working in orphanages and ministering to women who are victims of human trafficking. Not only that but your donations will allow me to buy maize for families as well as help provide clean water and medicine.

...YOU GUYS I LOVE YOU SO MUCH FOR EVEN READING THIS THANK YOU FOR HELPING & CARING ABOUT MY DEEP THOUGHTS LETS HUG BEFORE AND AFTER I GET BACK AND I WILL TELL YOU ALL THE THINGSSSSSSSSS THIS IS A RUN ON SENTENCEEEEE <3


-kamari

story:
Hello friends,

My name is Ryan. I am an entrepreneur from Vancouver B.C. Canada. When i was growing up i was always coming up with crazy ideas. I would attach fishing line to hooks i mounted in random spots in my bedroom. The line would be attached to my bedroom light switch so i could read in my bed and then when i was finished my book, i would pull the line and shut the light off. Yes.....a lamp would have been easier, but not nearly as fun....and aren't new ideas all about fun?? My mom always said i was a crafty little businessman. When i was in the 7th grade, i would buy a 2 pack of jawbreaker candies from the corner store for 10 cents, take them out of the plastic package, put them in an old Ferrero Rochet chocolate box that i had peeled the labels off of, and organize them in fun color patterns. Then i'd take the box to school and sell them for 10cents a piece, doubling my money. I wasn't into lemonade stands:) 

Now that i'm all grown up, my passion for new ideas hasn't subsided in the least. I'm always looking for something fun and new......and then came the Kombo Fishing Tool. I hated tackle boxes. They were full of stuff that poked me every time i'd reach inside. That was the 80's. Since then, hook boxes were invented and my fingers were thankful. But there was still a lot of clutter in my dads tackle box (i've never owned my own tackle box. My dads was a museum and i always fish with him...so why bother?) "There had to be a multi tool for fishing", i thought. But nothing existed that was very useful, in my mind anyways. And the Kombo Tool was born. It was the ultimate fishing tool. A fish 'bonker', or priest as is the common name for it, with a fillet knife hidden inside of it. And why not have a sharpener attached to it and a scoop spoon for the guts? Oh....and if it was the brightest green color and it floated, that would probably be a bonus as well. So we got to work. We had the tool designed in Vancouver and had a local injection mould company start stamping them out. We built a website, got featured on uncrate.com, were woo'd by the largest retailer in the world, sold out at fathers day and this was all within 3 months of our start date! Now, 6 months later, we have distributors in Scandanavia, Australia and Vancouver and are working on 2 distribution deals with the largest companies in North America. We are going on 'As Seen on T.V.' and were contacted by Groupon to do a national campaign. We are heading in the right direction and now we need YOU! We need to raise money to fund our next shipment and as most of you know, any growing startup needs capital. We have purchase orders coming in constantly and it is the large ones that we are here campaigning for.


As i mentioned above, we are doing some really cool marketing campaigns. Going on T.V. or Groupon will put us in front of millions of people in the largest consumer market in the world, and we expect the orders will be massive. When we were featured on Uncrate.com, the feature filtered down to dozens of smaller sites and our sales were approx. 30k in a month from that one website alone!

As well, our Australian distributor

is putting us in their large catalogue in February of next year and his expectations are very high as well. If we can get the $50,000 dollars we are trying to raise, this will allow us to order close to 4500 units to fulfill some of these orders. All of the money raised will go to purchasing inventory. We have our business set up and have used family money and our own investment to get to where we are today. As we grow, we will campaign to raise larger amounts of money to fulfill even larger orders. 

If we don't reach our goal, the money will still go to inventory. Some may go to travel costs for trade shows and some to marketing. If you are not convinced that I am driven yet, let me keep going.....I met with Bass Pro in May at their head office in Springfield, MO after hounding them with emails and phone calls for a month. The merchandiser and I hit it off and they are letting us set up a display booth at the front of their new store in Niagra Falls next April. I thought, 'if that worked, lets try someone else'. I like to think i have almost convinced Cabela's to do the same. We have been back and forth and i'm waiting for an answer this week. But hey, if they say no....i'll just keep emailing them and calling them:) Eventually they will say yes just to get me off their back. And when Bass Pro is a success, i'll send Cabela's the pictures and my sales figures. That should do it! 

Your contribution is so important to me and to this business. We have gone the route of investor but there are so many risks that go along with it. And honestly, its no fun. And for the most part, they want to see a return on their investment....and thats pretty much it. We are not all about a bottom line. I love the ocean. I will live and die by the ocean. (watch the documentary 'Sharkwater') We are committed to sustainable fishing and will do what we can to keep the oceans and rivers teeming with fish. We have contacted the David Suzuki Foundation in the hopes to work with them in the fight for sustainable fishing and to help save the planet in general. 

And yes, our tool kills fish and I may sound hypocritical, but it kills them humanely and one at a time. And we eat the fish we catch because they are a gift from God and essential to the normal function of the human body (google DHA omega 3). We were also inspired by Tom's, the shoe company that gives a pair of shoes to someone that needs them for every pair purchased. We want to be involved in giving back in someway to organizations that work towards keeping the earth healthy and fishy:) So we will give a portion of every tool sold, down the road, to sustainable fishing organizations, and we would love you to join us. 

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kombo-fishing...
